Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ishakp
Reviews.Content: I was recently on a whirlwind trip to the USA for the love of the NBA. We decided to watch a few games at the staples center, It was about a 20 min walk from there. LA being such a big city it is probably advisable having a car to see all the attractions. However as far as downtown is concerned it is pretty central. 50 dollar cab ride from the airport. Friendly staff, clean hotel, it has a lot of history and character. The concierge was only to helpful for any of our silly questions.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are an embarrassment for this brand”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and had problems from the start. I have booked a king and got to my room to find I was in a double/double. I went back to reception to be told its my fault as no non smoking king rooms were not available so they had given me a double non smoking and that smoking preference is not guaranteed. After having to complain to the manager, they agreed to reduce my room rate until a king room was available the next day. I was not surprised to hear over the days when I was near reception other customers unhappy at the rooms allocated and requesting room changes. The hotel lobby itself is all glamourous and glitsy but the rooms themselves are an embarrassment for this brand. The bath was stained badly ( in both rooms I had), the plaster around the walls was cracking and the bathroom didn't even have a door handle inner. I understand that rooms do wear out, but this was to the standard of a budget motel, not a high quality hotel as they claim to be. It has the big hotel brand set backs as well like having to pay for internet (now standard as free in most other hotels) and no fridge in the room to put a few drinks. On the positive side, the bed was comfortable and the house keeping kept the room as clean as they could in light of the high level of wear and tear to walls and paintwork. For the price, I would strongly suggest you look elsewhere. If thou can get the room at a good rate (closer to the $100 level), then give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting: Fun Experience”
Reviews.Author: Zoey J
Reviews.Content: We were there for a quick overnight, but we enjoyed the "experience." Staying in a hotel that's a throw back to the days of Hollywood grandeur was a unique, fun time for us. The room was your average room, with a unique decor (again, a nod to the days gone by). The bathroom is tiny, and our tub had peeling paint. We were "promised" fluffy bathrobes, but our room didn't have any. We were also promised upon booking our room that we would be on floors 3-5, but our room was on the 11th floor. Not that we really cared about that. Another "negative" if you can call it that, was we were promised "Club Access" which was complimentary cocktail hour fare, and breakfast in the morning. What they don't tell you until you arrive is that children may not partake in this, because it's set up for business travelers. My 10 year old didn't mind, but it would have been nice if everyone in my "party" had been able to enjoy the breakfast. What my daughter did enjoy was the pool, and we spent a good part of our brief visit at the Biltmore Health Club. I thought the lobby was breathtaking and the staff very courteous. The one BEWARE I will share with possible visitors: DO NOT STAY NEAR THE ELEVATORS. In fact, if you get to your room and find yourself close to the elevators, insist on another room. Your hotel room will offer you no sound buffering, and you'll hear the "ding" of the elevators all night long. Unfortunately for us, another guest on our floor (only a room or two away from ours), came into the hallway and was loud, drunk and banging on doors for several minutes, waking us up and putting a damper on the "relaxing" mood the hotel had created for us. I can't blame the Biltmore for that, but beware, you will hear everything going on in the hallway. Be sure to turn on the rooms A/C and it will drown out some of the noise - that's how we survived the night. And lastly - while very courteous and helpful - the VALET service will run you $40 per night, so be prepared for the cost of parking in Los Angeles. I had done my research and expected it, but if it was a surprise I would have been bummed out. Overall, just 3 stars because of noise, and a few details the staff overlooked. On the positive side, it was neat to be able to show my daughter a bit of living history, in this grand looking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with a beautiful lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Cadvise
Reviews.Content: Good value - rooms are older but have been remodeled. Overall I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Still a charming hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: BVostmyer
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on tripadvisor.com prior to our stay here and there were basically correct. The hotel is older and, even on the Club Floor, there are signs of age and lack of investment back into the property. That said, we loved our stay. The drive into the property is impressive with immediate and attentive bellman service. The current main lobby is beautiful with a quick check-in process. The main elevators require walking up a short flight of stairs but there is a side elevator on the main floor just to the right of the main set of elevators if needed. For Los Angeles, our Club Floor room was large and nicely appointed. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The Biltmore does not any longer include refrigerators or coffee makers in their rooms but they can be requested. There is a small daily charge for a refrigerator. The fridge we ordered was delivered immediately and was extremely quiet. The room was also extremely quite even though we were surrounded by other guests. For us, the Club Floor was worth the extra cost. It was open for continental breakfast every morning and provided a happy hour with drinks, appetizers and cookies from 5pm to 8pm every day. The hostess and waitress in the club were delightful and tried very hard to please every guest. Since I was visiting family in the Keck Hospital, I could drop in here for a light breakfast to go with great coffee in the morning without having to wait for room service. I also came in for the evening appetizers which made a complete meal for me. We did try room service one night - it was delivered quickly and the food was adequate as far as room service meals go. We also ate lunch at the Smeraldi's Restaurant downstairs off of the original hotel lobby. The grilled cheese with tomato soup was exactly what we both needed. I would recommend walking down the block to the Water Grill for an excellent dinner. The Water Grill is in the same block as the hotel and has never failed to impress us. Now for the not so good - the room we were in was not exactly clean or well maintained. The canopy over the bed was stained on one side, paint was clipped off the bottom of the walls in the bathroom and the bathroom fixtures are dated. Did this ruin our stay? NOT AT ALL!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Rooms for Celebrations, Tired Rooms for Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: FloridaDaytripper1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because of a celebration event. Old grandeur in exquisitely and ornately decorated ballrooms. Hotel rooms far from "grand". Frayed carpeting held together by duct tape when it was not worn too thin. Unrenovated rooms from tiny to average size but with teeny bathrooms. This is an OLD hotel. Renovated rooms on upper floors at least did not have hallway duct tape but still had torn curtains and tears in chair upholstery. Walls allowed noise from hallways and neighboring rooms to interfere with sleeping. Location is OK if you need to be downtown. No hotel-provided airport transportation. Suggest having your event in their Crystal Ballroom and staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice lobby but..”
Reviews.Author: CanIranRanger
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on Mar 17 2012. My sister was attending a nearby makeup show so the rate was something like $130 USD tax in for the night (not including valet). Regular rate is over $200 and way too expensive for a basic hotel. Looks like the hotel is more known for its lobby and ballrooms than the actual hotel rooms. Beds were nothing special (had better beds/pillows at the Anaheim Islander Inn) as you only get two very basic pillows. Nice TV but it was far away from the beds. Bathroom was old even though it came with enough towels and the basics (shampoo, soap) but we had some type of a water problem in the bathroom. Valet service was good although you had to wait a bit (5-10 minutes) but they had some 7-10 valets working at anytime. Not too many food options in the area..but it's close to the fashion/jewelery district. All in all..for $130, I wasn't mad but I'd never pay the full price to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Old, but cool”
Reviews.Author: catlaw98
Reviews.Content: The rooms could probably be a bit more modern, but the common areas are amazing. Wonderful tile work and great architecture. Location was within walking distance of the convention center and Staples Center. The staff was really friendly and I would easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's historic and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: camdaddy
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at The Biltmore for St Patty's Day 2012. Our friends live nearby and we all walked to Casey's Irish Pub for the festivities. The Biltmore is right in the middle of everything, but so is Hilton Checkers and Omni LA. You really should stay at one of those hotels instead. The lobby and public areas of The Biltmore are absolutely stunning and the history can only be matched in NYC and DC, but the guest rooms are really disappointing. The carpet in the hallways are taped with masking tape, the walls in our room (563) need paint, there are no pictures on the walls and we had an industrial toilet installed in our bathroom (kick lever type). I was told none of the guest rooms have been renovated. What a shame. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which was expensive. The best part of The Biltmore are the employees. We were treated so well by every employee we came across and we really appreciate that. It's obvious they know how significant the hotel is and are excited to answer any question we had. If you want a nice room, stay elsewhere, but make sure you visit The Biltmore and absorb yourself in history.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in a hotel with good character”
Reviews.Author: MCMinor
Reviews.Content: Although a cab ride or 13 minute walk to the convention center, I do recommend this hotel in downtown LA. Service was exceptional!! Bar has live music and a great wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: The lobby and common spaces of this hotel are beautiful with wood floors and beautiful molding and details throughout and definitely resemble old Hollywood. I appreciate historic hotels but this one could use an update. I was even upgraded to the club level on the 11th floor and I found that The bathrooms are small because I suspect they are their original size but it's too tight and non user friendly for such a high end hotel and the carpets are tired and seemed almost sticky so I stayed in slippers overall the hotel could use updating. I had no problem with check in. But it seemed everyone arond me had troubles, additionally upon check out they charged me a valet fee which thankfully they cleared up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: vetsmith
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with a long history and impeccable service. When you enter the lobby it will feel familiar and you realize you've seen it in many movies over the years: from the lobby, ballroom, and hallways to the swimming pool, you've known it all. Some reviews have mentioned the shabby condition of carpets in hallways and upgrading needed in other areas, but the charm of this hotel is in the authentic decor and the excellent service by the staff. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A landmark, with tired rooms and spotty service”
Reviews.Author: yaneh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on the way from San Francisco to San Diego. The lobby and common areas of the hotel are beautiful and fascinating, including the many old photos in the cavernous ground floor and the various spaces -- the garden that was the old lobby, the new lobby, the giant convention rooms where the Oscars were held in the 1920s. One can wander around and absorb the bygone-ness of the place. However, the rooms and service are also from a bygone era. Even though I upgraded to a "club room" on the club floor, which promised "all-new bedding" and other exciting perks, my stay was mediocre. The bedding was not new and was of very poor quality to begin with; the bathroom in the room was small and unattractive. The "club lounge" breakfast was one of the worst breakfasts I have ever encountered in a hotel, with just a few stale croissants, atrocious coffee, fake orange juice and a couple of slices of melon scattered about. Finally, the bellmen were full of attitude and after being not given a tip because of said attitude, became outright rude and sarcastic. I would definitely recommend visiting the Biltmore as part of your trip to LA, but stay elsewhere - there is much better to be had for the cost of a room at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Classic but needs to sharpen service”
Reviews.Author: Laurabelle927
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Biltmore on a recent business trip. It's an old place, but overall well kept; appeals to a snooty crowd. You can only valet park at $40 per day. My room was very small but comfortable, with very limited t.v. channels. I found several hairs in the bathroom that were not my own. I hate that. I attended a luncheon banquet where the food was very good - no rubber chicken! Upon checkout, I had to wait a verrrry long time for my car to be brought up. No apologies; no personal attention. Still a great location, in the heart of LA.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel with the worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: Candiland-Love
Reviews.Content: The rooms are terribly old. The hallway carpet is held together with burgundy masking tape. The rooms are humid. The hotel staff is arrogant, rude, and unhelpful. I would never stay there again and I'm embarrassed that I stayed there at all. This hotel should be closed for a full rehab project.

Reviews.Title: “our experience of the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne L
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed for three nights inFeb, The room was lovely but the view was not. There was a constant noise throughout the night from some sort of machinery outside. The carpet in the corridor was taped together but if one went on a higher floor it was like stepping into another world. The staff were excellent and kind. The gift shop alas was not I ordered something which I was told would be delivered to the UK within ten days.......am still waiting.Having paid $13-95 international delivery charge I am none too pleased. I appreciate the shop has no dealings with the hotel but it does ruin the reputation of an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Los Angeles Landmark”
Reviews.Author: Unavailable11
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore was constructed at the height of the 1920s land boom; few expenses were spared in the building of this landmark on Pershing Square, and nothing like it will be built again. The lobby and public spaces are grand and glorious and maintained with evident pride. The rooms vary quite a bit; we ended up needing a room with two beds instead of the king bed we'd reserved and were delighted with the huge and quiet room we were given, on the rear court of the hotel. Part of the pleasure of staying at the Biltmore is its lavish Beaux-Arts architecture; one has to accept minor blemishes of age as part of the charm, like the make-do repairs to the corridor carpeting. The level of service at the hotel is high and we found the staff charming and helpful; the maids wear black uniforms with white ruffled aprons that make them seem almost like historical re-enactors. The plastic cups in the rooms are the result of an L.A. county health ordinance, and housekeeping gladly supplies fresh glassware (and additional pillows) upon request. There are a lot of hotels in downtown L.A.; the Biltmore is in a class by itself.

Reviews.Title: “Full of history”
Reviews.Author: CanadaNewbie
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful old hotel! I'm so glad I had the opportunity to experience staying there as it is rich with history and you can "feel" the memories as you walk the halls and lobby. To think of all the people that have stayed there through the years, the parties, anniversaries, wedding and other special occasions that have been enjoyed there in the past is amazing. The rooms are very spacious, clean and quiet. The pool and health club are superior and staff were exrremely friendly. Parking is a bit pricey but no more than other high end or downtown hotels. The only negative - and it's enough that I won't be going back unless it is changed - is the internet. It is $9.95 per 24 hours which that in itself is silly with today's modern technology and access to Internet - but they charge that PER DEVICE!! So with two of us in the room from out of country, we each had a phone and laptop. That would be $40 for Internet! I don't pay that much for two months of unlimited devices so that is a bit much. Until that policy changes, I can't give the Biltmore a second visit or give it the recommendation it deserves.

Reviews.Title: “A Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: Sherz88
Reviews.Content: Some say this is the most photographed hotel in the world. The Beatles stayed here in the 1970s, arriving by helicopter and avoiding the paparazzi. My husband and I were at The Biltmore for the 100th anniversary of his law school, enjoying an after dinner talk by Justice Sandra Day O'Conner. The food was amazingly good for a 600 person banquet, and so was the service. We enjoyed our room on the Club level because we could have appetizers in the evening (smooth and easy) and continental breakfast in the morning (crowded; no place to sit). The most outstanding thing about the hotel, though, is its bygone era decor. See my photos. Speaking of photos, the hotel has vintage photos of the hotel and Los Angeles area throughout. It's a grand old place.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for Grammy weekend”
Reviews.Author: LuvFoodMpls
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore can be hit or miss with the size of the rooms and check-in did not go smoothly but I still loved staying here. It was great for Grammy week and the place was busy. Great bar and musicians on the weekend for great music. Rooms are a little run down depending upon what you get but it is safe and clean. Restaurants are good and coffee shops are close by. Overall, I would stay here again if I needed to stay downtown. Only bid downside is the parking charge for the car and they took a fair amount of time since it was so busy the day of the Grammy's.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 3Jenni
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here during our Grammy weekend. It was fantastic! We got upgraded to a Junior Suite at no charge since our room wasn't ready when they told us it would be--great customer service! The hotel is gorgeous and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: LaurieG33388
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Biltmore last week for a night so we could visit with family who live downtown Los Angeles. The location was excellent because we could walk to many restaurants. We felt safe walking around the area because it was very busy. The lobby of the hotel is very attractive. The hotel room itself was a bit strangely decorated- it was comfortable but seemed to be missing a piece of furniture such as a couch. There was a lot of empty space. We got breakfast included with our room (perhaps an AARP benefit?) so I think it was a value overall for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night in the City”
Reviews.Author: jamboe10
Reviews.Content: Steal of a deal through Hotwire. Centrally located to all the hot lounge/bar/restaurants in walking distance. The old world charm hits you right when you enter the lobby. If you get a chance to enter the Ballroom it will transport you to the era of the roaring 20's. We were there for a nice night in the city celebrating my wife's birthday. Thanks to the staff hooking us up with the larger corner room overlooking Pershing Square. Very friendly staff at checkin. The room was clean. Flatsreen TV. Bathroom was large but it is true that shelf space is a minimum. In the large room there are 3 desk areas which is nice. Lounge/Bar is hip at night(Friday) with a live jazz band that reinvents contemporary songs with DJ scratches all wrapped with a jazz bow. Drinks are expensive ($13 vs $8 at the Bonaventure). But, you're really just going to sip in this atmosphere. Valet is $40/night but I looked around and it seems close to standard for Downtown. If you had a rent a car maybe you would leave it outside, but I didn't want to leave my car outside overnight. The area seemed safe walking at night; well lit and lot of others walking from the many lounges/restaurants in the area. Really enjoyed our night in the city at the Biltmore! Would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: lynne s
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel. The room was fine, the bed comfortable and the bathroom clean and tidy. The aircon worked fine, the coffee maker worked fine, the tv worked fine. The staff were accommodating, friendly and helpful. Above all, the beautiful lobby and reception rooms/halls were stunning. It was all very 1930's and absolutely charming. The windows are not double glazed, but they are old and have shutters. All in keeping with the vintage feel of the hotel. A little traffic noise, but we did not experience anything too bad and I AM a light sleeper! The food and service were all good. The location of the Biltmore is also a plus as it is within easy walking distance of the theatre district and many downtown locations. Convenient to Blue Bus and Metro stops. Our experience was most enjoyable and we were sad to leave the Biltmore and Los Angeles. We would stay at the historic Biltmore again.

Reviews.Title: “you will sleep on the street”
Reviews.Author: E K
Reviews.Content: It is like sleeping on the street... You will here everything - every damn noise. The windows are very old in every room (we have changed 3 rooms) Noisy, noisy, noisy!!! :( ... that kills everything Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and needs a rehab...”
Reviews.Author: CornellHotelie
Reviews.Content: For being in the hotel industry, I must say that this place is awful. It starts with the fact that I paid $229 per night to stay here. The lobby and elevators are OK, but when you get to your floor (mine happened to be #8) - this hotel is screaming HELP! The hallway carpet is patched together with duct tape that matches the color of the carpet. The rooms are very large, which is great. However, I stayed in Room 883 and there is a crack in the middle of the room that is covered by carpet. One could easily trip. The rooms have a poor number of electrical outlets, but they've solved that problem by providing a surge protector strip by the bed floor. The desk has the same solution. The bed has only two pillows - even a Hampton Inn provides more. The bathroom - well the sink protrudes into the tub! The shower head barely functions because of the hard water build up. Honestly, it needs to be changed. The water is luke warm on the shower, but scalding on the tub. The toilet's flush reminds me of the one from my elementary school days. They provide one bar of soap, where it should be two: bath and facial soap. I understand that this is a historic hotel, but it needs a major renovation. If you're going to the area, I would recommend one of the other hotels. This place has such potential.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: gmjpeach
Reviews.Content: I have attened several bridal shows here, and have loved the old world romance. When we stayed here while attenting a show at the convention center, I was really excited. What a disapointment. Rooms were small and musty. Decor was not kept up, and the tempature in the room was never right. The MOST disapointing was room service. Although they supposedly have room service, I called in my order at about 8:30pm. I was told it would take 45 minutes. By 9:30pm I was starving, and called room service. They told me they were closed, and I would be on my own! I was so mad! I then called to the front desk to complain, and was told that it was an honest mistake by the person who took my order. They then offered me a menu for a nearby Italian delivery that would deliver this late. As I was already in PJs, I asked that someone deliver it to my room. Nope! If I wanted a menu, I could come and get it from the front desk. I sent my hubby down, and we called Italian to deliver. My biggest complaint was the price. We got a DISCOUNTED room from the convention of $135 per night. My friends who ended up here at the last minute paid $175 per night. On top of this, parking was $50 (i kid you not) $50! Per day! And there is no self park option. So my $135 per night was $185 per night, AND they charged LA and state tax on my PARKING, making it ALMOST $60! As far as this was from ANYTHING, I wished I had stayed at the Omni, as we have loved the other CA Omnis we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Don't complain, be discerning.”
Reviews.Author: tmarguerite
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay after I requested a room upgrade. My fiance was already staying in the hotel on business for 2 weeks. He was given room 976. I believe this room had to be one of the worst offered at the Millenium Biltmore. The room was very dark, facing a brick wall and the bed was broken. We asked them to fix the bed after my fiance fell out of it. They put a wooden plank under the mattress. It was horrible. The next morning, I asked them to upgrade his room to another room. Anthony at the front desk spoke with the manager, Christian, and we were given 1037. This room has views of both Pershing and the courtyard. There are windows in the bedroom and the bathroom. It is sunny and airy. This was a marked improvement. If you have issues with noise, you will not be happy in this room or any room facing Pershing. The quieter rooms tend to have horrible views. The brighter rooms with views tend to have street noise. The street noise was welcome considering the alternative. You could feel a bit of the energy of the city, view the ice skaters in Pershing Square and see the "angel" lights in the sky. Unlike 976 which required an additional power surge cord from the hotel due to the inconvenient outlets, 1037 had adequate electrical outlets. 1037 is not a suite however the layout is spacious and comfortable. It shares an entryway with another suite... I believe 1035. Although there were many guests and a lot of activity at the hotel due to the Showcase children's talent event in the lobby, there was nobody in the spa area. We made use of the wet/dry saunas, pool and jacuzzi. Greg Guzelian at the Gallery Bar was very personable and engaging despite the crowd on some nights. We had the buffet breakfast at Smeraldi's Restaurant most mornings and opted to eat dinner out in nearby restaurants - Cafe Pinot, LA Prime and Drago Centro. The food and service at each was very good. A piece of advice I give everyone, never accept the room given sight unseen. ALWAYS ask to see the room BEFORE accepting it. Hotels will usually provide a decent room at the onset when they realize you are a discerning customer.

Reviews.Title: “Aged and rusty”
Reviews.Author: Curi0usJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire and went with high expecations since it was rated 4 star. The room was on the 8th floor and was a king bed room. First of all, the room was so small, that the bed occupied most of the space. Secondly, everything was old including the fixtures in the room and the bathroom. The lampshades kept falling off when we wanted to operate it from bed. The bathroom itself was tiny with squeaky taps and rusted piping. The tub was so small, that I swear a 3 star hotel would have had better bath tubs. The only good thing about the hotel was the location. It was central to all attractions, so we did not have trouble visiting all the places we had planned to - hollywood, downtown, univ studios and santa monica. If you really prefer location, book this hotel only if you get good rates. We paid $90 bucks per night, so it was almost value for money, that's y I give it a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: deeferla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our choice becasue we got an incredible deal on hotels.com. It was super clean, quiet and incredibly beautiful- since we have stayed there in Sept/11 , we have seen it in movies twice! I fact they shot a scene for a movie there at the time we were staying in the hotel. The bar had great snack prices and service and a band. The 7th floor(?) had a lovely brekfast area and fresh fresh fruit with pastry and awesome coffee. the room was clean and bright and quiet- but the shower curtain was too short wetting the floor everytime. Bed fairly comfortable- (check it first before accepting the room). I would recommend it-- you can get a good price if you look- quite far from all the action of Hollywood and LA- but the subway is in the same block and you can negotiate for a cab fare in LA. it is 2 blocks from the jewellery district and clsoe to Staples center. The conceirge we had was young and knew NOTHING! I recommend getting a book on LA - taking the Redline Tours (also negotiable and bought at the Chinese theatre with free coupons given out) and the bus is super slow as LA is so big. Take a cab and maek a deal-- I also really liked the Camarillo outlet mall- outdorr -pretty adn about $10-154 cab ride from the hotel HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Aged but very nice”
Reviews.Author: tmoney1982
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you are going to be spending time in downtown LA. The common areas are really nice, and the rooms are aged but well kept. Would stay here again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Karan5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Nov 2011 and found the staff to be excellent. The girl at the check in was very polite and the conceierge was superb as well. The hotel is located in downtown LA however has easy connections via the Metro. We only used the Metro once to go to Universal Studios and found it a bit dodgy! Would recommend using a taxi. The hotel is very elegant and the rooms were great as well. A smile and a good tip to checkin staff can lead to an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “For some old Hollywood glamour - this is ideal”
Reviews.Author: CaroleD37
Reviews.Content: From the moment the doorman opens the lobby door, you feel like you are somewhere special. The lobby is simply beautiful - the ceilings and walls are just as impressive as the flooring. On the way to the elevators, you pass through another beautiful wide hallway from which you can access the restaurants, shops and get back onto the street. Just past the elevators is a balcony that overlooks a fountained restaurant that was serving afternoon tea when we arrived - very elegant. Once you leave the main floor, things start to look a bit old and used. The carpets in the hallways are split and repaired with red duct-tape (to match the carpet!). Our room was lovely - high ceilings and very spacious. The bathroom was quite dated, but perfectly serviceable, with a rather uninviting bathtub, but a great, powerful shower. Part of the attraction of staying here was the central location - very handy for walking around downtown and close to the highway to go farther afield. (I was happy to have my GPS though, as there are so many one-way streets and highways that filter left and right.) For all that it is right downtown, we had our window open and didn't hear any traffic noise through the night. The best part of the Biltmore, is it's amazing history and character. Sadly, we didn't make it to the pool, although it looks amazing in the pictures that I've seen since and we didn't get to have afternoon tea. Oh well, next time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: sdg14
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the Biltmore, since it's located in a great area and has "historic" charm. Unfortunately, its age shows tremendously. While the lobby is beautiful and the health club sort of charming, the rooms are "historic" in the worst ways possible. The HVAC system is the oldest I have seen in forever and works okay, if imprecisely (it's a dial system where you can sort of indicate a desired temperature and say hi/med/lo for AC or heat). There is ONE mirror in the whole room, in the terrible bathroom, with no floor length mirror even in the closet. And the aforementioned terrible bathroom has an institutional-style toilet, poorly planned towel racks, with a sink that encroaches on the shower's space. The toiletries are also in serious need of upgrade. The whole bathroom felt dingy and gross, and I have stayed at hotels and motels at all kinds of prices. The worst part is that I paid extra to stay on a club floor that is supposed to have extra amenities, such as robes and slippers. After I called to request the robe that was missing from my room, it never came (after two calls). Overall, I would not recommend. My husband and I were stay-cationing as we live in LA and were attending a wedding, but I would have preferred to stay at home. This place is dreary and dingy and there are a LOT of other places to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, lots of character, great stay”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Millenium Biltmore. It was great fun to wander downstairs and find an episode of "Castle" being filmed in the lobby. This hotel is a change of pace from your basic Westin, Hyatt, etc. so don't expect an oversized marble bathroom and 84 plugs on the desk. For business purposes I found it adequate, but it might not be ideal if you need to do a lot of business travel-y things. For fun and enjoying a convention, we thought it was great fun, comfortable, full of character, well located, and a great value. We did hear that room service was abysmally slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel apart from the bedrooms and the service”
Reviews.Author: hawks21
Reviews.Content: Very mixed emotions regarding the review of this hotel. Being a massive movie fan, I found the history of the hotel and the events that it has hosted very interesting. There are a lot of photos around the entire building which really takes you back to the 1920's and 30's. The bar and bar staff are very good and the food that they serve is also very good. Unfortunately, the rooms are terrible and in need of a massive re-vamp along with the halways leading to the rooms, they too take you back to the 1920's and 30's but for the wrong reason. Our trip was somewhat spoiled on our last full day, as we were advised by a member of staff at the concierge desk (Josh) to visit the six flags theme park just outside the city. This was something we really wanted to do and so got him to book the tickets on the morning that we wanted to go. On that morning we asked to organise a shuttle however we were told that it should have been organised the night before, when we asked why we were not told the night before when enquiring about the tickets, the answer was "I must have forgot". Josh then advised us to rent a car just across the road. We didn't really want to rent a car, however did so because we really wanted to go to the theme park. So, we spent about an hour hiring a car, setting up a sat nav and started to make our way out of the city (40 miles) and when we got to the park, guess what? The park was closed, which everyone apart from the concierge seemed to know. I am in no way saying that this was done on purpose, because it wasn't, the sad thing is that we had spent $140 on car hire and $120 on park tickets, not to mention the loss of 4 hours of our day. Josh really did do everything he could to try and get our money re-funded, but the hotel seemed to refuse, or at least thats what it looked like. All we got from the hotel was $40 to cover the cost of our taxi back to the airport. We were assured that both the hire car cost and park tickets would be refunded to our credit card, however it has been 12 weeks since our visit and still nothing has been done. Its a pity that I have to write a review like this, however no-one from management in the hotel seemed to want to help us or even cared about what had happened. Just to recap - The lobby and downstairs in the hotel is very nice. The rooms and halways leading to the rooms could be straight from a scene in the Poltergeist movie. The concierge have no idea what is going on in the city and the hotel management dont care one bit about how their customers have been treated.

Reviews.Title: “Failed at the basics”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: When you're traveling for business you want a clean, quiet room, internet access, and seamless/easy, efficient checkout and valet. The Biltmore tanked on all counts. I was in LA for business for only one night. I was originally given a small room that looked onto a brick wall. As I had to work in the room all day, I asked to be changed to a room with a view. They gave me a new room, but it turned out to be worse. The hallway leading up to it smelled dank, and the room smelled also. I thought it smelled like cabbage or something food-y that might go away after a while, but it didn't. I tried to use the wireless internet, but could not get on to it because the signal was too weak. After staying in the room for a while working, I took my shoes off and walked to the bathroom, only to have my socks soaked with water. The carpet was soaking wet on the half of the room closest to the bathroom, which explained why the room smelled moldy like boiled cabbage. I was hesitant to ask for yet another room, as when I asked for the first change the staff seemed kind of annoyed, and also by that time it was late at night and I just needed to get some rest for the next day. The room was dank and cold, and when I turned the heat on it didn't help. So I didn't sleep well, in addition to the noise from the skating rink below. To be fair, the staff did tell me about that, but they said it as I was walking away already, key in hand, as if an afterthought and as if I had no choice anyway - i.e., "oh, by the way I hope you don't have any sensitivity to noise because that room is noisy"... why didn't they just give me a room that wasn't noisy? The hotel is huge and I can say it did not seem at all busy. Then, I ordered breakfast, but when it didn't come at the time specified, I called (and although the card was taken from the door handle), they said they never got the order. It was too late by then and I needed to check out, so I decided to do the express checkout by tv. However, when I turned the tv on, there was an error message saying there was no signal. Later, it took almost 30 minutes for the valet to get my car. (The garage is in the hotel.) When my car finally came, I had to wait again while some tv crew told me I couldn't walk out the door to my car because they were filming. The car had to be driven around the block again, while more filming occurred and I had to wait even longer to get to my car. By the time I actually got into my car and headed to the airport, it was I had missed the opportunity to take an earlier flight out. The hotel didn't seem especially busy, so why was it so hard to get these simple things right?

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: RogerBERG
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights on the Club Level of this classic hotel. Great breakfasts! Concierge is there to provide services. An outstanding stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Steeped in old Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: soqueljimmy
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a great place to stay if a downtown LA experience is what you want. Many people brush off the fact the LA has a distinct heart, but it does. If you wish to explore some great LA history, this hotel provides a wonderful hive for you buzzin' bees. First of all, the hotel is an amazing place of history and architecture. The lobby, gallery and "Rendezvous Room" have amazing ceiling frescoes which are not to be missed. The people who work the Millennium Biltmore could not have been more helpful or friendly. The history of this hotel can be seen by the many photos on display in the gallery. JFK was chosen as the Democratic candidate in this hotel, not to mention the many Oscars held here. Secondly, the hotel is in a great location. One can walk to most of the historic sites of old LA. My wife and I went to Angel's Flight, Grand Central Market and the Bradbury building in about 1/2 hour on foot. Historic Pershing Square is right across the street from the hotel. We also hit the seedling of LA, Olvera Street and the wonderful train station of LA, Union Station, which has been featured in many films (and for good reason). Both of these are a quick Metro ride (two stops) from the station across the street from the Biltmore. The LA Metro was clean, uncrowded and easy to manuever. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't come back here”
Reviews.Author: tmtkw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore for 1 night for business. The lobby is gorgeous but the room is old, I know this is a historical hotel but it is just an old hotel that I wouldn't want to stay again. When I arrived in the hotel, the porter was shouting (singing?) which scared me a lot. Also, when I checked in, even though I asked to assign a room away from the elevator, the receptionist gave me a room next to the elevator!! The location is good, it is middle of downtown. But the room is old, just old. Since windows don't completely close, you can hear noise from outside. The hotel should have soundproof because it is in Downtown!! Unfortunately, when I stayed at the hotel, there were at least 4 helicopters flying around the hotel through the night trying to arrest hundred of occupy LA activists, so I couldn't sleep at all!! The bathroom is old as well. It looks sad, just looks like a sad bathroom (Pls see the photos) They charge the wifi at about $9 something/night/DEVICE, so if you use cell phone, lap top and tablet, you have to pay more than $20/night. Overall, I don't think I will come back to this hotel even if its for free!!

Reviews.Title: “Manners are sometimes a hotels single most important thing...and a hotel is only as good as the worst employee”
Reviews.Author: Perrin123
Reviews.Content: From the outside and the lobby areas, you cannot deny that is is a lovely looking hotel. Checking in was slow, however friendly (lowlight, highlight). I had booked a club room (floors 10 or 11) and it was a high standard, a little dated in places (especially the bathroom) but comfortable and spacious enough for my nights stay. I cannot comment as to the standard of the non club rooms. Took advantage of the evening reception for club room stayer in the upstairs parlour, which was nice...a good selection of wines, other drinks and snacks. Definately a bonus having paid the extra for a club room. The gallery bar was nice, and did great cocktails. The onsite pool was small, but time it right, then you will not have a problem. Time it exact, you will have it to yourself. The locatiom is typical of downtown LA...a bit of a walk to get to anything, however, it is convenient for public transport. The two onsite restaurants were considered for evening meal, but the menus were quote uninspiring, and quite empty...didn't feel like sitting in a goldfish bowl so opted for room service. The free breakfast for club room was good. Ask at the desk to store luggage for day, and the real low point of a three week holidday was the rudeness of the conceirge who gave the impression of being less than obliging to tag and look after the bags. I think perhaps for this reason I would not recommend...lasting impressions and all. No excuse for rudeness. Nice looking hotel but I don't think it quite hits the mark of what it wants to be. They do old style charm in a sort of out the box corporate 'bulk buy' feel. I would recommend however, the incident at concierge is my last impression...and manners maketh man...in this case the lack of them maketh not recpmmeded.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here...”
Reviews.Author: TastyTraveller1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore for 2 nights in November for business. Firstly, this is NOT a business hotel. In fact I am not too sure what sort of hotel it is supposed to be... Oh I know, a rubbish one! The hotel is old and dirty. The bathrooms look like they are from a bad 1960's hotel, and they have not even tried to refurb them. If they were clean this may help but that they are not. After heading up to the 8th Floor to my room on the second evening I discovered my key card was no longer working, a common "feature" of this hotel it seems as my colleagues suffered the same fate. When I went all the way back down to reception there appeared to be a very long line of guests checking in with 1 person on the reception desk... bare in mind in was 1am and the group was expected as they were there for a conference. As I did not feel I should have to wait in this line as I was already checked in and just wanted my key card replaced so I could get to bed, I was told to join the back of the line!!! There were about 20 people waiting... after kicking up a fuss eventually a very surely manager appeared and changed the card, without apology I might add. NOTHING about this hotel was good. Do yourself a favour if you are reading this and check into one of the mainstream hotels 5 mins down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Haunted!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1st time in mid September. I chose it for the charm and knew going in that the building would be old and not updated based on reading reviews. It was not the cleanest but it wasnt filthy either and was not the run of the mill hotel. Stayed 4 nights. Felt creepy the minute I got there. 3rd night woke with bed shaking and saw blue orb size of a basketball and a dark cloud above my bed which hovered there for 15 minutes. I was alone and scared and so began to pray. I have never seen a ghost or anything of the sort before in my life. Found out later the place has reputation of being haunted. That weekend I also found out that they had a convention of people who seek to locate demons and ghosts so maybe they brought them in. This experience has changed me. I still feel fear as I know these things now exist.The food and the service was excellent. Walls thin and could hear EVERYTHING outside. Not peaceful and quite at all as hear everything downtown as if windows were open.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Unique”
Reviews.Author: digihuman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore in LA for the Blog World Conference in 2011. I picked it because it was the one among the conference offerings that had some style and unique elements to it. If you like fantastic interior architecture this is the place to stay in downtown LA. It is imbued with the style and mood of 1930s Hollywood; ornate, detailed and glamourous in it's design from the flooring to the ceiling of every public room. It is well worth the stay, just for that aspect. The rooms themselves are small but clean. Not fancy, but perfectly fine and functional. My room, with a single king bed, had the dresser at the end of the bed with not a lot of room to navigate in between. It would have been better to have a slimmer stand for the TV there and the larger dresser farther into the room where there was a lot of empty space that could have been better utilized. The bathroom was also small but they did an admirable job of making enough counter space for it to still be functional. I was alone on this trip so I only had my small toilet kit. I have my doubts as to whether my wife would have had enough room for all her stuff, actually I know she wouldn't have. The bar had fantastic brisket tacos that I got to enjoy two nights in a row. I don't drink so without that food and Ginger Ale I wouldn't have known about the jazz band they had playing. They were fantastic, setting the mood for enjoying the final hours of our conference. The service personnel were wonderful, cleaning the room, helping to get cabs, explaining maps and just in general doing their job very well. Another element I mentioned in my last review is true for this one as well. Nightstands need plugs right on them for recharging, as does the desk. It's 2011, time for all hotels to understand that is a necessity. I would recommend the Millenium Biltmore for business travelers, for tourists who love fantastic interior architecture and decoration, Hollywood buffs who like that era and anyone who wants to stay in a unique space instead of a generic 'anywhere USA' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night's stay!”
Reviews.Author: raebroughton
Reviews.Content: Our party were on a tour across America and this was the last hotel during our stay. Check in was quick and efficient and we found our room to be fairly small but nicely decorated. The room was clean and the bed was also comfortable. Whilst we waited for our luggage to arrive another couple on the tour mixed up their room numbers and were able to use their key card to access our room. I found this to be unacceptable, my husband had to go down to reception and inform them of this. They weren't too concerned and said they would look into it and sort it out. The luggage finally arrived just under an hour later. I can understand that with a tour bus arriving it would be very busy for them so the luggage can be slightly overlooked. Our stay was just for one night and in the evening there was live music in the bar area which was very good. In the morning of our departure most of the tour were sat in the lobby whilst waiting for our transfers to the airport. The staff in the lobby kept walking around us and giving funny looks. They obviously didn't like us waiting in the lobby, I didn't appreciate this and they made us feel uncomfortable. Overall the room was lovely with a comfortable bed and the live music in the evening was very entertaining. However due to the problems we encountered I don't think we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: marieszuka
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Biltmore is in a great location in Downtown LA, which is why we chose this hotel for a weekend getaway. The lobby is grand, the service was great and the room was so-so. If you can get a good deal, it's well worth it for the experience. Admittedly, the room was a little shabby, but keep in mind that this is a very old hotel that has been updated, it hasn't had a complete overhaul. The room was a good size and we were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Glamour Meets Sub Standard Rooms”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter580
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobby and some very caring and committed employees (and some not so committed or caring too!) It filled me with expectation the rooms would be spectacular until the elevator doors opened on the floor and i noticed the carpeting was old and held together with maroon duct tape. The room itself is so sad. Old, poorly and cheaply furnished (although the bed is actually comfortable) with one of the worst bathrooms I've ever seen. Dirty shower curtain. commode as close to the floor as any i've ever seen, no place for any toiletries. The fan in the bathroom is grating and grinding against the metal housing as i write this. It's a gut job for sure. Food is unimaginative as well.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel for the city”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to working in downtown LA, but it turns out to be not too bad. More hilly around here than I expected. Feels more like San Fran. But this hotel is the best surprise. Beautiful interior decor, architecture, and classy ballroom. For some reason it reminds me of the Shining movie with resemblance of the Stanley hotel. I recommend this hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start, got better”
Reviews.Author: AlexMove
Reviews.Content: Guaranteed booking with credit card, upon check-in, no King rooms left. Gave us dodgy twin room on top floor. The chillers on the roof were above us and it felt like a helicopter was on the roof. Sooo noisy. We asked for a new room and that was marginally better. Next day, they gave us another room on the 7th floor which was pretty good. Staff at reception were polite but not overly forthcoming with solutions or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Judy H
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my one night stay at the Millenium Biltmore (before my early morning appt. at the Doheny Eye Institute)...a 4-star rated hotel, I had high expectations. The hotel was truly beautiful. Checking in was easy. I arrived at my room, which was adequate at best. The king sized bed barely fit between the walls....there were no outlets to plug in cell phones, ipods, etc. Lighting was poor. the bathroom was a joke, so small that I couldn't even make a cup of coffee without it spiling over the floor for lack of counter space...I went to the restaurant for dinner and ordered one of the price fixe meals...steak, medium rare...the steak was covered in gravy (never a good sign). the obnly part of the meal that I enjoyed was the spinach! And how many times do you hear that spinach is the highlight meal???? The next morning, after I showered, tried to use the hotel's hairdryer....the dryer worked fine, expect that it was not connected to the wall and the shelf in the bathroomm was too narrow for it to rest on, so it hung down to the floor as I dried my hair. I think I could have done better at a Motel 6. Breakfast was fine.....and checking out and hailing a cab went well. Would I stay here again.....NO.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation Urgently!”
Reviews.Author: Bpanama
Reviews.Content: The Place needs an urgent renovation. The staff is very nice. We had to leave. The room that was assign to us was a disaster the curtains and the lamps screen were shredded. The other rooms that were offered one was a smoking room, the next one had all the rugs glued and put together with scotch tape very bad. Really nothing compared to their pictures, I could even say the pictures are deceiving. The staff was so embarrassed they returned our money, they could not stop asking for excuses, took us to our car, made the return charges to our credit card, they behaved very well. But the owners should renovate the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good for One Night... No More!”
Reviews.Author: Miguel-Mex
Reviews.Content: Good Points: Very nice hotel with the architectural taste of Hollywood's Golden Age. Warm welcome at the reception desk. Very good attention from all staff members. Excellent location in Downtown LA. Bad Points (mainly concentrated in my room): Standard room and bathroom very small and dark with the shutters open. I can sleep with all the noise but not with light; the lower part of the door allowed filtration of light and noise from the hallway to the room so I put a towel on the floor to cover it. The light from the thermostat so bright. The AC system sounded like a train passing by every time it started. Not very comfortable pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Character”
Reviews.Author: Sneekee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Biltmore a couple of weeks ago for a wedding and have to say this hotel is absolutely beautiful. The only problem is, since it's an older hotel, the a/c was not working as well as we would have liked and it was humid throughout the entire hotel. :( Not good for a bunch of bridesmaids trying to stay cool and dry for pictures. The hotel was beautiful though and the downstairs bar is great as is their lobby. Great place to hang out and say I stayed, but not sure if I would pay as much as I did again.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves Much To Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: ajay04_10
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is like an aging dowager with the make up cracking. The rooms are a decided contrast to the opulence and grandeur of the lobby areas. Surprising that they havent been brought up to the mark. It was fortunate that we stayed in club rooms, though even these were far from luxurious, but at least they gave us access to the club lounge for continental breakfast and evening tea and drinks. The quality of these meals was good. However, the hotel lacks an attractive restaurant which could fit in with all the grandeur. Not much sense in commenting on the neighbourhood, since if you've chosen to stay downtown, you must have had a reason for it. Overall, it leaves much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful lobby, tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cruzinquick
Reviews.Content: One of the most magnificent lobbies on the West Coast, worth a special stop to take a look. Unfortunately, once you get upstairs you will find hallways with taped together carpet and dingy paint. Rooms a little bit better, but stains and worn woodwork greet you. Remodel has been delayed about 5 years too late. If you look past this, a good sleep. Pleasent staff, good location.

Reviews.Title: “A far cry from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clarence G
Reviews.Content: Outside of the lobby and possibly the bar, this hotel is closer to what you would expect at a low budget motel on Route 66 than a 4 star hotel. The room we stayed in was dated circa 1960 except for the flat screen tv. The bathroom was so small that my left foot rested in the room while sitting on the toilet. For what we paid, you would think the hotel could have splurged on a full size bar of soap. No such luck. No minibar and the room smelled stale. The "icing" on the cake was the valet parking charge. Ouch! I was extremely disappointed, and felt misled by the 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: accurateinformation
Reviews.Content: This place is cool. Nice and old feel to it with lots of history and is located at the heart of things (though downtown is pretty rough!) Shame the staff forgot why they get paid. Not even a welcome at check in. Seriously. Nothing. Nada. hardly looked up and just handed room key over. Had to ask the concierge the way to the lifts! And when leaving not even a thank you or a how was your stay. Nor was there any apology for the multitude of things that went wrong - e.g the 30 minute wait ot get your car out of valet parking every time - would have been longer if we didnt remind them three times! and only on the third time did they send someone to get it - unbeleivable lack of manners - no apology -just hands reaching for tips This attitude is pervasive from check in to concierge (who sent us to the dumbest bar in the area!) Such a shame One exception to that rule would be the cleaning staff - very pleasant and efficient As for the rest of them especially check in and parking supervisers but also the concierge staff- terrible service and a dont care attitide. Kind of ruins things By the way rather than pay for parking at $40 a night with such rubbish service - park across the road for $8 overnight. And you dont have to wait 30 minutes every time you need your car

Reviews.Title: “Needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: MBarb10
Reviews.Content: The history of the hotel and it's grand lobby is what attracted me to stay at the hotel. But that's were the beauty ended. My room felt like a closet, stains on the carpet and the bathroom was barely big enough to turn around in. Could use us a significant renovation. The front desk was frequently understaffed, with the check in lines being six people deep several times during the day. And the bellmen were sporatically present. One morning, I wanted 10 minutes for a bellman to showup to get a taxi for me. I finally gave up and walked down the street to another hotel to catch a cab.

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel, with an amazing ballroom”
Reviews.Author: travelingchef33
Reviews.Content: i know some people might not like how the rooms seem outdated...but, one must understand the historical value of such a place. we appreciated that fact that, the hotel tries to keep its historical identity. we attended my bestfriends wedding here. it was a fun and wonderful wedding. staff was attentive and polite. we also had a few drinks at the lounge..which was also nice because of its design and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Lobby, lack luster staff....”
Reviews.Author: tentmaker
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's an old hotel so don't expect it be like a Trump Tower...but what was so disappointing was the staff. I arrived from the airport at 9:30pm to meet my spouse who was already checked in and in the room. Walked in with my suitcase and NO ONE would help me find an elevator.... bellmen, front desk staff, all present and not assisting anyone...they simply looked my way then continued what they were doing.... never acknowledged I was even there, had to ask for help..crazy. Next morning needed some help from the concierge...yeah, forget it,,, lazy, did not want to help, and while we stood there telling him what his job was, he was rude to two other hotel guests... the valet guys outside refused to hail cabs, we stood in line for 25 mins till finally a hotel guest went out on the street and hailed four cabs... the staff was a real let down... must be poor leadership.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel however probably wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Tracie H
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great on the website and from the outside and lobby however don't be necessarily fooled! So lets start with the positives: Great grand lobby, easy to find from airport, cleanliness is 4 star, friendly staff, decent size rooms, good bar if not a little formal and expensive - You may even recognise the hotel from TV programmes such as 24 and entourage or A list star films!! Now for the negatives: Expensive valet parking 40 dollars a day, advised by waitress on first day not to leave hotel as many roads adjacent to hotel lead to Skid Row or other dangerous areas, Location is downtown LA financial district so restaurants and bars are a fair distant between them, Bar a tad expensive and formal, overpriced internet charges, rooms a little outdated and in need of a make over. Nice for business or short stay but not recommended for vacations or romantic getaways!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Good and Bad ! Dont Get Fobbed off with the old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M
Reviews.Content: Stunningly Good: The entrance, lobby, service and food. (especially breakfast) Stunningly bad: The rooms Poor: The decor in the breakfast restaurant. The arrival is very good, The meet and great from the staff, the Lobby and all the rooms around the entrance are quite amazing and the history of the place oozes out at you but I am afraid, that is where it ends. We had booked a club junior suite and given a room on the 5th floor. The corridor carpet was frayed and had duck tape on the joins, the decorating was old and the room had a bad odour, very old and tattered furniture, dirty windows, dirty bathroom, frayed curtains and carpet with stains. Plus a noisy air con. Called downstairs and complained and was given a room on the 10th Floor. I noticed in the lift (when going to the replacement room) that floors 10 & 11 are club room floors, so it was obvious that the receptionists try to fob people off with bad rooms instead of giving them the correct room to begin with. 10th floor, what a difference. new corridor carpet, room had new 'old style' furniture, clean bathroom, carpet, windows, curtains etc. What a difference. Totally refreshed decor and excellent Air Con. If we had been shown this room to begin with, Then the hotel would genuinly be a 4 to 5 star grade, The room service was very quick (15 minutes) The food was surprisingly good, very large portions and breakfast both downstairs and in the room was of the highest standard. It is a shame that The Millenium group dont refurbish the rest of the hotel, the rooms on the lower floors can be summed up as 'faded glory' The club breakfast (on the 10th floor) is just a basic continental. So we went downstairs to the breakfast room restaurant. It does a very good hot and cold buffet for $19 which includes eggs / omletes made to order, juice, coffee toast etc. This is exceedingly good value for LA and the quality is of the highest standard. Unfortunately the room is a bit 'cold' with tiled floors and decor that needs some updating. The room we had on the 10th floor has a very comfortable bed and excellent quiet air con. We would stay here again, but only on 10th or 11th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: hrg24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful. When walking into the lobby it is absolutely beautiful. Costumer service was not very good, but not bad either. Rooms: were okay. When walking into the hotel you also expect fantastic rooms, however that isn't so. The rooms are good, clean but not fantastic like the rest of the hotel. No fridge or minibar, but instead there is just a coffee maker. Beds are comfy, and bedding is good. Bathroom is not very big, but okay.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kevincanada
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has a beautiful lobby and common areas but the rooms are outdated, grimey, have paper thin walls and are not pleasant to spend time in. The bed is beyond firm and the pillows are either too thin and soft or hard as cardboard. I could hear everything the guy in the room beside me was saying to a friend on the phone in NZ at midnight and everything his kids wanted for treats. the location is good for being downtown and the valets were quick and very nice. The old shower frame fell apart when I was in it and for the $300 plus per night this was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, uninteresting area”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a beautiful hotel. Lots of history, magnificent decor. The reception area and the coffee lounge are really nice. The bar, which was pricey, had live music at the weekends. Choice of a couple of restaurants in the hotel. Both were good and not too expensive. That's fortunate because there is virtually no entertainment or restaurants in the immediate area, - just a Starbucks and a pizza takeaway. Is there another Downtown that we missed? Lifts (note, up several steps) took us to our bedroom on the 9th floor. Room was very nice, good size, functional, comfortable and quiet. Wifi was charged. Staff, especially concierge, were polite and helpful. Since LA is so spread out you really need to hire a car. There is a car rental office in the hotel. Take to the coast,-it's beautiful, and wasn't too crowded during our time there.

Reviews.Title: “STARS, STARS, STARS!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpringChick2920
Reviews.Content: The ambiance was great and they had extremely friendly staff to assist us. They had 3 motion picture filmings in progress! Ran into a few celebrities during our stay. The only downfall was the very small bathroom and indoor pool, but everything else was terrific. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Megan A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Millennium Biltmore in August 2010. I actually wasn't hugely impressed by LA having never been there before. However the Millennium was a great hotel and we were treated very well. The hotel has a fantastic history and there are photos all around it of events held there throughout the years. The swimming pool was particularly enjoyable after our 13 hour flight. The staff were engaged when we spoke to them and although the hotel is perhaps a little tired and could do with a slight renovation I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Biltmore LA, great spot downtown”
Reviews.Author: AnnieEC
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had stayed at the Millenium Biltmore last December so she could visit FIDM, her top college choice nearby. Resonates with early Hollywood history, rooms are very comfortable, and the location in downtown LA is superb for exploring. We returned there in late September to get her settled at school and the Biltmore was just as accommodating. Stayed on the Club level (10th flr) this time; room was peaceful and well maintained. Breakfast was included on the 10th floor - civilized, delightful, just enough. This time my time was spent either at her apartment, at FIDM or at the LA Public Library across the street, and I'm a walker, so the Biltmore was the perfect base. Parking across the street under Pershing Square is very reasonable. And a movie was being filmed at one of the Biltmore ballrooms during my stay - great interiors for that! Great value, love the ambiance, and the location. The staff is unobtrusive but available when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel. Beautiful architectural detail.”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyed
Reviews.Content: I came for a conference and stayed for two nights. I loved the beautiful architectural detail in the lobby and the meeting rooms. My room was on the 11th floor. It was spacious, clean, and had comfortable beds. The downside of a historic hotel is the difficulty to control the temperatures in the meeting rooms as well as the sleeping rooms. I like that the windows in the room open, but the drawback is the noise outside. Service was good-from check-in to concierge to housekeeping to wait staff. Everyone was personable and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Movie hotel, but not always in a good way”
Reviews.Author: GiselleF
Reviews.Content: If you watch television or see a lot of movies, you've probably seen the public spaces of the Biltmore several times. I have no quibble with these spaces, as they have a nice character. But the private spaces are a completely different movie. The rooms aren't what I would delicately call "dated." I would call them old and ill-furnished, dark, and with cheap looking built-ins. How did an old Route 66 motel get built on top of an old world hotel movie set? It boggles the mind. The next morning I tried to take the stairs closest to me down to the lobby, since the elevators were far away down the winding hall (think The Shining). They were carpeted and not behind a closed door, so I had no suspicions I might be getting into trouble. A couple of floors down I found not the lobby, but rather an empty dark service area. Yes, that's right. It's the dingy basement of buildings where climactic television foot chases take place, and there's no egress to the lobby. I had to climb back up the stairs to my floor and then take the elevator down. A sign that the stairs lead to nowhere would have been helpful. Service at the front desk for me and my colleague in another room was ok but not friendly during check in or check out. It's pretty busy in the lobby, so don't expect much in the way of attention. Hotel is downtown, so don't walk around at night. Anyway, you'll have to have a car and pay for parking, because it's LA. You can generally find cheaper rates for the Biltmore online, especially last minute. There's a reason for this. Ok for business travelers but not recommended for couples wanting a romantic getaway (you won't want to stay in the room for romance) or families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But not 4-Stars from my point of view”
Reviews.Author: ssmosley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Millennium Biltmore hotel from Sep 23-26, 2011. It is an older but very large hotel covering almost a whole city block. The doormen and the receptionists were all very friendly and polite and I was registered and given my key. The lobby is large and ornate, though the decoration and fixtures are rather dated. My surprise started when I arrived on the 8th floor! Banged-up walls flanking threadbare and worn out carpeting patched up by masking tapes and then in my tiny room # 875 rotting wood around the windows, a bathroom door that is warped and won't close, a sink that seems to be clogged and a bathroom that dates back to the 1960s! I had dinner at the coffee shop that evening as well as breakfast on subsequent mornings and the food quality was excellent and the prices very reasonable. The valet parking is $40 per 24 hours and during the week that is less than what you'd pay at a parking, but over the weekend (Friday evening - Sunday midnight) you can park your car at the public parking across from the hotel on Grand street (same place where the hotel valets) for $24.00 per 24 hours. There are a number of other eateries around the hotel: a small bakery cafe and a Starbuck's just around the corner, an Irish Pub (Casey's) across the steert on the next block, and many others. All in all I'd say this hotel was fine, I got used to the rather uncomfortable bed and the tiny room, but I wouldn't give this hotel more than 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest room... evar!”
Reviews.Author: lolawally
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel for my work for two nights. It's an older hotel with some amazing decor in downtown LA. Not a great neighborhood, I'll say. I would not have felt safe walking around the area alone at night. My issue with this hotel was that I had one of the noisiest rooms ever. I was on the seventh floor, a corner room, and I could hear every bus door, their braking, and the on-board next stop announcements. It might not have been so bad, but there are buses going through every couple of minutes in the area. It made for bad nights sleeping. The room itself was a little dated, the TV choices were pretty limited and the flat screen TV was the opposite of high res. That said, the service was quite good and friendly. Room service was GREAT, I thought. Oh, and internet is $9.95 a day and the connection is pretty okay. I could stream video without issue.

Reviews.Title: “Back for another try at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: There is no denying the beauty of the public spaces, the high charges for parking at the hotel, or the fact that most rooms are on the frumpy and tired side. It is an historic hotel, so the character is going to show in nice trim, many coats of paint (sometimes chipped), thick walls (the only noise is from the very noisy street and the hallways), and the time-gone-by look of the rooms. Mine, this time, is perfectly satisfactory. The lamps are flimsy (and frankly, I washed a few of the switches and doorknobs and things because it had too-well-used of a feel) but the room is just fine. Tiny bathroom with few amenities, fast internet for $9.99 for 24 hours, high tea if you want it and many large tour groups. The AARP is here now and loving it. As an AARP member myself, I hope they are having a great time! This is not a hotel I would select for myself but for a business trip it is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel - Evokes glamour of early 20th century”
Reviews.Author: charmseeker
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience -- beautifully restored hotel - spacious rooms, elegant waiting areas, gorgeous bar, good food (just had breakfast). Great giant photographs all over showing the famous events that took place there - grand balls, the Emmy galas, staircase was scene of a Hitchcock film. The area around it is fascinating -- also historic - there is a landmarks commission that provides a self-guided walking tour that gives a wonderful glimpse of old Los Angeles. Parking is very easy -- underground garage across the street. Personnel was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: BGK190479
Reviews.Content: Millennium Biltmore is centrally located downtown Los Angeles. Bus or metro to many of Los Angeles attractions was located just across the street. There were also several dining and shopping opportunities i the area. The bellmen are very friendly and helpful. The concierge on the other hand was not very helpful regarding tickets to attractions or other information. They also hide away the brochures and only hand them out if you ask for one specific. However, they have made a list of buses and metros going to the different attractions including approximate travel time. That was very helpful and going by local transportation might be as fast as using a pickup bus stopping at every downtown hotel and much cheaper. The room was quite big, but since it was a double room it should have been two chairs. There was no free internet access and that is too bad i 2011. There are probably thin walls since I could hear the television from te room next door, but it no problem. The hotel has a quite big pool compared to most other hotels I have stayed in and one of the best fitness centers I experienced in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place with Beautiful Architecture”
Reviews.Author: lowprofile1
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights on our arrival in Los Angeles at the Biltmore, and our last 2 nights, three weeks later, on our departure from the USA. The hotel is nearly 80 years old but has kept up with the needs of the modern traveller. Our first room was a Club King room on the 9th floor. Lovely sized room with lovely decor and a very comfy bed to sleep away our jet lag after a 14 hour flight from Australia. The bathroom was old, but very clean and had everything we needed. A club room includes breakfast and hours d'oeuvres in the evening included in the room price. .Also includes free wi-fi in the Club Room area. On second stay, we booked a normal king room which was on the eighth floor. This room was much smaller, and we had a couple of problems with the hot water and TV reception. But after a quick phone call to reception we had someone from engineering come to the room within a few minutes of the call. He was unable to resolve the problem straight away. so got us moved to a room further down the corridor. This was a room with 2 double beds, but a much nicer room. The lobby area and all the downstairs areas are amazing. The hotel has such history behind it and all of these areas are maintained beautifully. The Rendezvous Court is a lovely place to have lunch or just sit and have a drink after a long day of sight seeing. Staff where all very helpful and always pleasant. The girl at the concierge desk was very helpful and booked our flight to Vancouver, all just as part of the service that the hotel provides. If you are looking for an ultra modern hotel, this is not the hotel for you. The rooms are dated and perhaps could use a bit of updating, but all in all everything else about the hotel outweighed this minor problem. The only downside of the rooms that I found, was that the rooms do not have a bar fridge. They do provide an ice bucket, and there is an Ice machine on most floors, but if you want to have any of your own food in the room, there is no refrigeration. We loved our stay at the Biltmore, it was an amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wanna-be-vagabond
Reviews.Content: I read all the mixed reviews for this hotel but decided to book it because of the great weekend price and location. I was not disappointed.
