The hotel is beautiful and as other reviewers have stated, elegant and lovely. The room we had was a corner room with windows on all sides. Yes, the bathroom and room is not modern but we loved that it was so charming. The windows were wood windows that actually opened and allowed for a cool breeze throughout the room. Also, I loved that the bathroom had a big window that opened too. The room was clean, comfortable, and filled with light because of all the windows. The heated pool was wonderful. We swam every day of our visit. We loved the large marble steam room and there is a dry sauna too. The exercise room and locker room/showers were more than adequate and we appreciated that there was no additional charge to use the facilities. Although parking is expensive, we avoided the $40.00 parking fee by parking at the lot right across the street for $6.00 all day with in and out privileges. It is an outdoor lot on the corner but there is an underground lot across the street too. This hotel is only a block away from the Metro so we took the Metro to Koreatown since we knew parking was almost impossible on a Saturday night. The hotel is also 2 blocks away from Central market which is a great place to pick up lunch. We had dinner at a restaurant called Church and State, which is about a 10 minute drive from the hotel. It was delicious but reservations are a must. We had a great weekend and this hotel will definitely be the hotel we stay at when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Old glory”
Reviews.Author: BojanLo L
Reviews.Content: A few days ago we stayed at the Biltmore. The hotel has a good location (Pershing Square) and is very close to metro. The hotel's lobby is absolutely beautiful, the cocktailbar is great as well. Overall, the service is good. The rooms have good furniture, but the hotel is quite old. Meaning, the mattress is old and squeaky, there are single pane windows and the bathroom is old. The most frustrating thing is the amount of noice coming from LAPD copters at night (single pane windows) and the staff can be quite loud in the morning. As usually with big name hotels, the internet is $10, the parking is $40, there is no fridge or microwave in the room etc. Overall, a wonderful building and good service, but definitely not the right value for money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessReed
Reviews.Content: I have noticed a lot of negative reviews for this hotel, and I don't know why. I cannot fault this hotel one bit. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful 1920's Beaux Arts style and still carry the elegance of when it was first built. The dining options and bar are really good, and the health club facilities (including an amazing indoor pool) are more than adequate. The hotel's public areas have been used numerous times for movies, and they were filming whilst I was there last. I stayed in a club level room which I would highly recommend, as it is slightly larger and comes with access to an exclusive lounge, where continental breakfast and pre-dinner drinks are served daily, with access to free wi-fi, concierge, etc. The room and bathroom are a bit old, but it is important to remember that you are staying in an historic hotel. This doesn't affect the quality of the bedding, linens, furniture etc, and these were to modern standards. The service was impeccable - no request was too large, service was prompt, and every staff member I passed greeted me. I arrived at 8am after a very long flight way ahead of my 3pm check-in, and I was given a room immediately. The location was excellent - I managed to spend 6 days in L.A. with no car because access to the more than affordable Metro/Bus system was so easy. People should be aware that L.A. downtown is atypical of other city areas; at night it is relatively quiet, and there are some homeless around. It is not unsafe though, provided you stay away from certain areas. Downtown these days is a vibrant place during the day - I managed to spend 2.5 days just downtown, visiting museums, landmarks, and exploring the historical areas. I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here again next time I'm in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Underwaterlife
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Biltmore is the classiest place to stay in downtown LA. Though not in a sleek state of repair the glory of the original 1920's Beaux Arts and Revival style resonates through out the hotel. The cafes, lounge, pool, and lobby allow you to relax in the grace of a different place and time. The exercise facility is state of the art. Very reasonable prices can be got for weeklong stays and if you opt to park off site staying at the Biltmore is practically a budget deal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great staff, but not the most convenient”
Reviews.Author: adl08
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because it had fairly good reviews on TripAdvisor. I'm glad we listened, because we had a comfortable stay. The staff was really nice, the room comfortable and much larger than I expected, and the valet parking was convenient, though pricey. Being downtown was not convenient for us, but I would consider staying here again because I care more about clean rooms and kind staff than being exactly where I need to be.

Reviews.Title: “very good - value for money and true LA landmark”
Reviews.Author: byswiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Biltmore Millennium Los Angeles in early September 2011. Location The hotel is conveniently located in downtown LA - walking distance to music center and to subway stations taking you to Hollywood and universal studios. Parking is not much of a problem - there are public parkings all around the hotel - I used however the valet parking as it was included in my room. Valet parking was very efficient and fast and I would definitely recommend it. Lobby and public areas The hotels features extensive and big lobby and public areas - all nicely decorated and in excellent condition. Check-in was easy and staff was friendly. We did not visit the bar. Breakfast in Smeraldi's Restaurant We took breakfast in the Smeraldi Restaurant only once - it was a little disappointing. While staff was nice and professional as always - we did not enjoy the restaurant's cold and "cafeteria" like atmosphere. But in the ends this would be a matter of taste - food was alright. For the coming days we took breakfast in the club lounge. Rooms We stayed on the club floor and were lucky enough to get a corner room. I would definitely recommend the club floor rooms - they seem much nicer as the standard rooms. The room was nicely decorated and felt somehow "historic". Don't believe any comments about small outdated rooms - our room was big and perfectly maintained. Air conditioning was also very efficient. The only negative comment about the room I could give would be the old non-isolating windows - you would indeed hear street noise a little - but on the other hand that's what you gotta expect anyway from a downtown hotel. The bathroom was very nice too, clean, old but in excellent condition. It even did feature a window. Club lounge The club lounge is only open for breakfast and afternoon/evening drinks - a little disappointing. Breakfast was good, selection though not extensive. Evening wines were just average but snack selection very good! Overall - the club lounge is a great place to relax and grab a bite and definitely worth the money. The Biltmore millennium is awesome! I really loved this hotel - its tastefully decorated, well maintained with very friendly and efficient staff, great location and has of course this wonderful old Hollywood charm. If you are a fan of the Hyatt's and Marriott's of this world - you will be disappointed - if you are looking for an authentic property with history and character - the Biltmore Millennium it is.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: xd3vili5hx
Reviews.Content: A brilliant & clean hotel to stay in. Stayed for 4nights in April/may 2011.. Pershing square (metro) was just across the road which has a line taking u straight to universal studios, walk of fame, hollywood and other tourist places. The hotel lobby is absolutely breath taking - however food+room service charges are sky high! The rooms are fine, clean and hav wht u want except a mirror!! U have to use the bathroom mirror all the time. As it's in downtown l.a is vry rough outside of the hotel.. The homeless in the parks, parks smelling of urine and u don't feel safe walking the local area at night! The hotel has parking but is was $40 a night!! So u rather pRk else whr for much less - $5-$10 and ur car is safe there! I really do think hotel parking should be provided as part of the package as the rooms are expensive! We paid $170 per night!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Millenium hotels”
Reviews.Author: dutchboy81
Reviews.Content: I was initially a little hesitant after having horrid experiences at Millennium's in both Paris and London a long long time ago, but honestly I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Yes the lobby and main hall are the main features of this hotel and they are truly stunning and yes when you then get to the rooms you do get a slight feeling of: "oh, hmm..." But having said that, the rooms do have everything you'd expect of a 4 star hotel. (ONLY thing missing for me was a filled minibar but the bar downstairs did not disappoint! lol) The only real disappointment for me was the bathroom, no shelving and generally just a very plain tiny white room with only a massive mirror covering on one whole wall and a dirty white-ish shower curtain in the tub. We had breakfast in the club lounge which was nice for a continental breakfast and also the snacks in the afternoon were of good quality, just don't understand why this lounge is limited in time. Most club lounges these days are open from let's say 6 am till 23:00, this one was breakfast time (sorry unsure about the morning times) and approx 6 pm till 8 pm only. Overall though we were all very satisfied with this hotel. There is a Macy's just around the corner for last minute souvenir shopping and they give all tourists 10 per cent off (ask any person for it, it's worth it! lol) and a Wallgreen's. The underground is only like 5 minute walk so excellent location. Overall, would recommend this hotel but if possible, definitely go for a Deluxe or Grand room.

Reviews.Title: “I love old hotels, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Lislcat
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? My husband was in Los Angeles on business and my daughter and I decided to tag along and make it a vacation. The company that he works for, has offices located just two blocks away and has an agreement with this hotel. Therefore, we didn't choose it, nor did we have to pay for it. That being said, entering the hotel lobby is like going back in time. It is spectacular! The entire 1st floor is wonderful. The staff are exceptional and are really the very best part of this hotel. From the car attendant, bartender, check-in staff to the people working room service. All these people were wonderful! The room that we had on the 8th floor, was not! I've heard that they have done renovations on the Club Level floors, but they need to renovate the entire place. Our room was roomy, but there was tape on the walls, holding things in place. The carpet was ratted and frayed. The bathroom was tiny and had holes in the walls, marks on the door and the door would not shut. I had to go to another floor to get to the ice machine, which I didn't mind, but I was the only person in the halls and it reminded me of the hotel in the movie The Shining. It just gave me a creepy feeling. My husband asked the other people there for the conference what they thought of the hotel and they all said the same thing. The lobby area is beautiful, but the rest is creepy and needs to be renovated. I've stayed at many old hotels in large cities and I loved the character and charm they possess. Letting a hotel get rundown, is not adding to it's charm. I liked the area that the hotel was in and we caught the Hop On, Hop Off bus just across the street from the hotel on Grand Avenue in order to tour Hollywood, Santa Monica, L.A., etc... We won't be staying at this hotel again, until I read a review that says that the rooms have been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good service, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Nicolaassebastian
Reviews.Content: We can really recommend this hotel. Safe zone to slepp, there are some bars and restaurants around the hotel. We had a rent a car, so it was no problem to arrive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: LJB777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the heart of the business district of the Downtown area, within easy access of bus stops and the metro. One small downside was the number of tramps hanging around the metro station entrance and within Pershing Square (opposite hotel) which at night (when all of the business people had left) felt quite intimidating. The hotel had a very impressive lobby but the corridors were a little tired. The room was clean, tidy and relatively spacious. It had a coffee making machine which we thought was a nice touch. The staff at the hotel were very helpful with directions and information about the area. We had a few cocktails in the bar which had a good atmosphere, however, we unfortunately missed the famous 'Jazz Night'. The Downtown area has a number of tourist attractions worth seeing, including :- Central Market; Angels Flight, Union Station and Chinatown. From this location we gained easy access to 1) Venice Beach which was a 45 minute bus ride away; 2) Universal Studios which was on a direct route from the Metro (a 2 minute walk from the hotel) and 3) Hollywood Bouvlevard, again, a direct route from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Old, classy gal”
Reviews.Author: Maorish
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, but she's still beautiful. The lobby and public spaces are very nice, the bar was cozy, and the room and bathroom were small, but nice. Beds a little soft. Old radio with ipod connector. Interior rooms have view across courtyard. Front desk service was very good, bartender was very nice. Overall, old hotel, but still good.

Reviews.Title: “Great and historic structure - service was weak”
Reviews.Author: evelyninhouston
Reviews.Content: Very central and a beautiful building, but spotty service - 20 mins queue to check in (at 10 pm!!!) but got upgraded to a suite - my colleague rang down for a plug adaptor and was told they would have to collect it themselves etc etc. Finally, Fitness Centre very dated.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, old and run down”
Reviews.Author: Jsohn001
Reviews.Content: Broken tiles in the bathroom and tub, horribly dark room with a stench. The hotel is old and run down, looks like they haven't renovated since 1950. The walls are so thin, there were people running and screaming down the hallway all night. Do not stay at place, not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Pricy for such a small room”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler78
Reviews.Content: The lobby and check in desk area was beautiful. We also ate breakfast at the buffet and it was very good. I would eat there again even if I didn't stay at the hotel. The room was clean and nice, but quite small. We had booked a double bed room and when we checked in all they had was one king bed room. I had to sleep on a roll away twin bed. Not my idea of luxury, and if we hadn't complained they were going to charge extra for that roll away! Also the bathroom tub didn't drain well so by the time I was done with my shower the water was halfway up my leg! I'm sure a little drano would help, we just were busy and kept forgetting to call maintence. We would have also liked more plugs for th room. We had to take turns charging our phones, cameras and laptops. We didn't rent a car, which we should have because all of the touristy things to do were at least half an hour away from downtown so we spent $30 at least each time we got in a cab. I would suggest staying in Hollywood if you want to sightsee and get to the beach. We did try and get a rental car on Sunday afternoon but the concierge kind of got an attitude with us saying everything was probably closed. I live in Ohio and I've rented a car on a Sunday...your telling me the big city of L.A. has no place open??? Also wifi was $9.95 a day extra. I think all hotels now-a-days should really provide this free to guest. Aren't we paying enough? Heck I get free wifi when staying at the Laquinta!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ken_N_SF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Biltmore Hotel in Los Angeles and enjoyed my stay very much. The Club floor service was excellent. The beds in the room were very comfortable, the room was clean and the air conditioning in the room worked well. I felt at home in the room and would definitely book a stay at the Biltmore again. The complimentary breakfast was very nice and a great way to start the day. One note, I parked across the street (under the park) for 15.40 vs. 45.00 at the Biltmore. I was very satisfied with my stay, the staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Nostalgic. Would stay again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: WanderTribe
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews before deciding to stay here and many mention that it is run down or that the neighborhood is kind of sketchy. I can see where people say it's run down as the carpets do seem to have that yesterday's look, but I thought it added to the nostalgia and found it inviting rather than a turn-off. As for the sketchy neighborhood, I also see why it was mentioned, however, we found it a very convenient location and not once did we feel unsafe. We took public transport the whole time we were there and even returned after midnight one evening. We were 4 people - 3 women and a 17 year old boy who were clearly tourists and not once did we feel uncomfortable in the neighborhood. It is well lit and we often saw officers about. The hotel itself is grand with beautiful common areas and a gorgeous pool/spa area. The beds were sooo soft and comfy, but firm for a beautiful night's sleep. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat and will stay there again if I ever return to LA. Speaking of downtown LA, it was clear to us that they've spent a lot of effort cleaning it up and it's really become a gorgeous city to explore so do yourself a favor and check it out while you're there, it no longer deserves a 'dumpy' reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rashedabionka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the biltmore july 2010. From the get go it was a nightmare. My best friend arrived in la before I did and the hotel would not let her check in w out pying for a $100 "incidental fee" even tho she told the hotel I was in transit to the hotel. She waited 4 hours before she was able to check in!!! When I arrived I was told they were out of double beds. So 2 girls had to share a king bed! The next day we asked to move and they claimed they still were out. However, we met 2 guys who had checked in 2 days AFTER us who got a double bed room!! I was very upset. Also parking $30 per day?!!! The hotel is also in a bad location, around the corner from skid row. Not close to anything exciting. The room is a good size, bathroom a lil old. Hotel needs updating. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTED, WE WILL NEVER TRY TO STAY THERE AGAIN!! OVERBOOKED AND GAVE OUR ROOM TO SOMEONE ELSE!!”
Reviews.Author: jennyc326
Reviews.Content: Would advise before you register at desk to please check to make sure you are getting room that you booked. We got there, they had overbooked and gave our room that was supposed to be double beds to someone else, offered us room with king bed and 2 rollaway beds, What a joke. was gonna charge same rate and would not discount for their mistake. Needless to say, we did not stay there and will never book at this hotel again ever. PLEASE CHECK RESERVATIONS AT DESK BEFORE YOU SIGN ANYTHING!!! TEXAS

Reviews.Title: “Horrible management, miserable employees - stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: beachbummer24
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is exactly what I expected based upon these reviews and the pictures provided by other tripadvisor members. The lobby area is very picturesque and grandiose, while the rooms are a bit outdated and badly lit. The worst part about the room was the bathroom -- I felt dirtier after showering in it than I did before showering. First of all, the shower had three walls (uhh...yeah...), which meant that the entire floor got soaked when you showered. The water pressure sucked and there was mildew and slimy gunk coating the floor and walls. Gross. The toilet was also weird - it was like an industrial toilet that you'd find in an airport bathroom or something, and just seemed to be out of place. Also, the wireless internet is $10/day. Don't think you can just use the business center that the hotel boasts about on their website, because they charge you $0.50/minute for internet usage. Nice, eh? The main gripe I had with this hotel was with its management. I was staying there with a friend, who was the one paying for the room. Her flight was delayed and I ended up arriving at the hotel 1 hour before her, so she called and put my name on the reservation. The hotel manager, Albert, told her that they would need to swipe my credit card for security purposes in order to check me in, but that nothing would be charged and they would charge her card when she arrived. When I got to the hotel and asked for Albert, he was very dismissive with me and had zero interest in handling the situation, even though he was the one who spoke with my friend. He passed me off to one of his hotel clerks and before giving her my credit card, I confirmed with him that it would NOT be charged. He very impatiently told me that it wouldn't be. Fine. Well, the next day I logged onto my credit card account and I had a pending charge of $100 from the Biltmore Hotel. It turns out that even though the hotel didn't charge me the $100, they still sent a $100 authorization through in case my friend didn't show up and I had to pay, which causes the bank to treat it as a pending charge. Even though I asked SEVERAL TIMES about any charges to my card, the $100 authorization was never mentioned by Albert or any hotel clerk. My bank (Bank of America) usually reverses authorizations within 3 business days, but since I was staying at the Biltmore over the weekend, it would not be reversed before I left LA. In other words, it was basically like the hotel charged me $100 and promised to reverse it after I left LA. How does that help?! What's worse is that I intentionally only brought that one credit card with me to LA, because it had a moderate credit limit and I didn't want to go crazy with the spending while I was there on a girl's weekend. It was just a minor annoyance at first, and I went downstairs completely calm to talk to someone about the hold on my card. I spoke with Miguel who was very nice but ultimately couldn't help, and he went to get Albert for me. (Can you see where this is going?) Albert - the hotel manager who is supposed to, you know, actually care about the guests - took about 15 minutes to wander out of his office to do me the favor of speaking to him, and then had no idea what the issue was even though Miguel had briefed him on it. He was immediately defensive about it, interrupting me and talking loudly over me, and told me that he did tell me about the $100 authorization. It was a complete lie, and when he saw that I was getting upset, he changed his story and said he must have told my friend about it on the phone and she didn't pass it along to me. I 100% know she would have told me me something like that, and when I asked her later about it she said that was a lie and he never mentioned ANYTHING about an authorization, much less a $100 one. We went back and forth for about 10 minutes, which consisted mostly of Albert talking to me like I was a 2-year-old and insisting that he was right and I "didn't remember correctly". Not once did he apologize for the inconvenience, and whenever he let me speak (a rare occurrence), he rolled his eyes and looked up at the ceiling instead of actually listening to me. After he finally shut up I told him that I came downstairs completely happy and just wanting an explanation, but after being told that my friend was a liar, I apparently had a memory problem, and not being offered one measly apology, I was livid. He shrugged his shoulders like he couldn't care less and that was the end of it. After I informed him that I was going to be writing a negative review on tripadvisor he did say, "I apologize if you misunderstood about the authorization, but ...", which is a worthless apology in my book. If you have to threaten the hotel management with a tripadvisor review in order to get a semi-decent attitude out of them, I consider that a hotel I don't want to stay at ever again. He so obviously does not give a crap about the guests of this hotel (read the other reviews that mention the horrendous management!), and his employees looked miserable. In short, this hotel might be adequate, but if you have any problem whatsoever, be ready to want to yank your hair out. I've never experienced such shoddy customer service in my life. I love visiting downtown LA but I can guarantee you I'll never make the mistake of staying at the Biltmore ever again. The Hilton is right across the street and their reviews (and rooms ... and bathrooms ... and restaurant ... and ...) far surpass the Biltmore's.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historical Landmark”
Reviews.Author: brooksterann
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel central to the beach areas of Los Angeles as well as Dodger Stadium and Universal Studios. The location was perfect although getting around downtown can be tricky (thank goodness for GPS). Not really a "family" hotel, however my teen & preteen sons got a kick out of the old photos and historical feel of the place. You really feel like you step back in time ~ both with the elegant decor of the lobby and the room decor. Hotel was clean, beds were fine, room service and bell service was great. We got a good rate through a "name your own price" website, and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms & facilities need some "refreshing" - continued nickel & diming”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on a corporate rate ($160) that included free Internet access. Pros: - Stately old hotel - some spectacular architecture & decor. - Fitness room, while dated, has lots of equipment although a few modern elliptical trainers would be a welcome change from the one circa-80's model! - Convenient location - a block from Pershing Station, many restaurants within walking distance - Large spacious business center with multiple PCs and printers Cons: - Nickel & diming hasn't changed since my last visit - Internet was included in my corporate rate, otherwise it's $10/day. Using a calling card was $1 each time - nothing obvious posted to reflect this. - My shower had two settings - hot & scalding. I asked on the second day to have someone look at it - no change on my third shower... - Elevators were far away from my room location, but no stair appeared to provide access to the lobby floor - Limited front desk staff at peak times in morning - at checkout only two (out of six?) front desk stations were manned, and the lineups could get long

Reviews.Title: “Fine Old Hollywood elegance”
Reviews.Author: ittybittyboo
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is one of a kind elegant old world ambiance plus. Take your camera the Architecture is worth the stay. An afternoon High Tea is served in all it's glory one the Best afternoon Tea's ever. Stay on the Club Floor great food, treats & beverages. One stay and you will return. Remember this is an old elegant Hotel so don't expect modern rooms or bathrooms. Beds are comfy. You really need to experience the Biltmore

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: DavidMJS
Reviews.Content: ~Stayed a while ago, loved the grand interior, has a special feel to it. ~Japanese restaurant downstairs was enjoyable, as was the place connected on the side. Italian restaurant inside wasn't impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Old Lady badly in Need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: SKG109
Reviews.Content: We checked in about 4 PM. They 'upgraded' us to a small room on the Club floor as I was a registered Club member. The AC was off, so we started it and then went to dinner. At 10 PM the room was still HOT. The Operating Engineer on duty checked it out and then talked to the Front Desk Manager and moved us to another room. He also gave us access to the Club lounge, which the Front Desk had asked for $50/night. Much nicer, larger room, the AC was on but the room was HOT! The same Operating Engineer came and played with a number of things, and then said that the best thing would be for us to open the windows. We did that and the room cooled down but then we were woken by the Garbage truck sound early in the morning! The Front Desk Manager reduced our first night's rate by 50%. The hotel lobby, bar and common rooms are very nice. Unfortunately, the rooms badly need upgrading. The sink taps, the shower tap, the shower curtain rod are all ancient. We did have breakfast in the Club Lounge on 2 days. The food was basically identical. No eggs, no Toast. They also were charging $20 extra for the third person. Tacky! They charge $9.95 for the WiFi, but each computer or iPad or iPhone is charged separately!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: SandraEd
Reviews.Content: Good rooms well kept and clean. Flat screen TV, plenty of bathroom amenities. Coffee maker. Large room and I would be happy to stay here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs update”
Reviews.Author: bt-travels50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a wedding. It was very disappointing. First, do not park here. Overnight parking is $40 per night. There is a garage across the street for under $16 per night. I waited 30+ minutes to check in to this hotel. The line circled around the lobby. What made it even more frustrating were the hotel staff talking to you in line to ask if you have any questions about the area. I realize these were concierge staff, but cross-train your employees so the check-in line isn't circling around the lobby! Most of the hotel rooms are very small. The bathrooms are even smaller. I don't recommend 4 people in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Huge improvement”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLover72
Reviews.Content: Well i did return to the Biltmore,many times! Tripadvisor only lets you review every 3 months so the Biltmore had to wait a bit for its positive review. Service has improved tremendously..partly perhaps because they know me for a regular, partly because the worst offenders seem to be gone, so it appears I was not the only one to notice the slipshod service. At any rate this beautiful hotel has begun to live up to its looks, services friendly & helpful, beautiful rooms (at least floors 9 thru 11, cant speak for the others as have not stayed on lower floors) Drivers & bellmen are really on point, front desk is obliging with room requests. Only thing that might be improved is restaurant. Not that the food is bad but they are competing with Checkers at the Hilton right across the street, where the food is excellant. all in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesMexicoLancPa
Reviews.Content: We did the Coastal Starlight train trip so our hotel was part of the package for an overnight. Upon checking in I was not impressed by service as the gentelmqn checking us in made it clear he did not have a reservation under our name - when I pulled out my convirmation and he checked it against that simply handed us our room key - As someone who works in the hospitality - I would have ben a bit more "warm" as truly when he didn't have a room under our name, I felt "helpless" being tired and just wanting a room to take a shower after being on a train for 30 hours! Other than the less than stellar check in the hotel is nice, clean and the housekeepers are friendly! We had a drink at the bar and the service there was very good.. Nice fitness center also.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel needs help”
Reviews.Author: Dash22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding at the Jonathon Club around the corner. Rooms are old and in need of a face lift. Could be a cool hotel, price is reasonable except for $40 a night parking, food is not good, service was ok but I did not expect much, bed sheets are rough and pillows are uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: britoldgit
Reviews.Content: how anybody can fault this hotel i do not know,it is beautiful,the staff very polite and very helpful rooms are spotless it was the last hotel on our trip and was a. perfect end to our holiday.thank you millennium biltmore

Reviews.Title: “Enchanted yet convenient place”
Reviews.Author: AdriBarre
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is one of a kind hotel: a unique place to connect with a glamorous history. Take a walk through the lobby and the corridors while listening to â€™30-â€™40 music, go for a drink, watch the ceilings, and pay a visit to the incredible pool or the Olive St. main entrance. Breath-taking. This hotel was also really convenient to connect with highways and go to touristâ€™s spots in no time (always opposite direction from commuters heading the Financial District). Our room was correct, neat and service was helpful. A bargain! Extra reccomendation for hotel's restaurant: Smeraldi's. Top quality service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, run down rooms”
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel and the parking attendants were just standing around and were in no hurry to help us in any way. We stood around for a while after someone came to the car, then nobody helped us get the bags out of the car so we found our own luggage trolley and started loading the car ourselves. Finally when we were almost done, someone came to help us with the rest and took the trolley from us. We checked in without issue and the bellman was great but this did not excuse everything else. We got to our room and my face just fell. It was such a disappointing run down room. it was spacious but both the furniture and carpet were old and worn. The bathroom did not have any soap so we had to call the front desk and my boyfriend was put on hold for 20 minutes. Unbelievable! The shower did not have much water pressure and we had to play around with the shower head for a while just to have it release a reasonable amount of water. We wanted a nice luxurious hotel with good service and were disappointed with both. We will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay here...lap of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: JulieJ0122
Reviews.Content: We moved here after a disastrous checkin at a dive hotel near downtown. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The place is beautiful, the concierge know what impeccable service really means, and the beds are as comfy as home. I needed a late-night snack and the concierge directed me to a nice little store about a block away from the hotel, where I found sandwiches, salads, and much more...all freshly made & reasonably priced. We loved staying here very much, and if we return to L.A., this will be our chosen place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel; great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravler36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium because our friends were staying there, but it turned out to be a great choice. The hotel lobby, bars, cafes, lounges were all so spacious and beautiful. Each person who worked there was as nice as could be, from maid to security guard or concierge. The food was excellent there, and we ate at the restaurants more than once, although it was , of course, costly, as is typical for an LA hotel restaurant. Would definitely recommend for a downtown hotel with a lot more personality than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Questions remain over security of rooms”
Reviews.Author: FJKToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in May. There was an incident one morning where after leaving my room and returning for an item after less than a minute, I saw a member of the housekeeping staff exiting my room. She said that I had left the door open which was incorrect. Besides, it would have been easy to pull the door closed. There would have been no need to enter. On the same trip another member of my party had a wallet go missing. The last place he confirmed he had it was in the room. I emailed the details of this to the management of the hotel and did not even get an acknowledgement of my email. I would not recommend a stay here. The rooms were nice but it is not worth it for the worry over personal security. I won't be back and was disgusted not to have received a reply from the management on this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Lobby and public areas. Rooms a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Dicksan
Reviews.Content: We were there for a trade show...hotel was full but they handled it well Great downtown location. Wonderful public areas. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms on the small side owing to age of hotel. Bathrooms small too, and amenities are not up to a high end standard. Coffe maker in room was good. Probably really 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HelloFromOregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Biltmore and could not have been happier. We asked for a room with a view that allowed smoking and we were given a front corner room on the 4th floor with views towards Pershing Square. I really loved the huge windows that opened. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. The hotel itself is very lovely, they have a beautiful pool from the 1920's with amazing tile work. The location was perfect for exploring downtown and for using the metro and light rails to get around LA car-free, which makes LA so much more relaxing. We really loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with a feel of royalty”
Reviews.Author: gautam355
Reviews.Content: the millenium biltmore , as a hotel was above our expectations. the designs of it loby areas are really worth giving a nice look. the staff was very courteous, and very helpful and cooperative, as we had reached the hotel at 9 am, but still they had the room ready for us (with no extra charges). Inroom dining quality was quite good, and so was the morning breakfast's . if you want to stay in the down town LA area, this hotel is my strong recomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown.”
Reviews.Author: projecth
Reviews.Content: Its fine, bt for the business reveled? You can do better. I chose the hotel because I got a conference rate but wish I had gone elsewhere. The wifi is so slow its unusable!

Reviews.Title: “Old School”
Reviews.Author: airpixie
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Millennium Biltmore this past weekend. Overall, we were really pleased. The staff were all very friendly, especially Jessica at the Front Desk, who I'm pretty sure upgraded our room for us. We paid $160 for the night, which seemed reasonable. Unfortunately, valet is $40/day. If we hadn't been traveling with children and loads of luggage, we would've parked at a neighboring garage or parking lot for less. The hotel is definitely old-fashioned but full of character and history. I've been staying in mostly modern hotels, so it was a welcome change. I enjoyed walking around and looking at all of the unusual details; the health club/indoor pool- incredible 20's style, beautiful stairwell, gallery, old photos, lobby. Our room/bathroom were a decent size, especially considering it's in the city. There was a huge walk-in closet. I personally liked the old details in the room; vintage windows, doorknobs, etc. We also appreciated the map we were given that pointed out all of the nearby restaurants, which are within walking distance. My only complaint was that you had to enter our room through a second door that was shared by another hotel room. Our young neighbors were part of a wedding party that continued partying well into the night. People were constantly going in and out of the doors and it was REALLY noisy. I was trying to be cool and not complain, but thankfully security came up on their own accord and told them to be quiet. Thankfully they were after that, but those two doors slamming shut and drunk kids knocking for hours was rather annoying. So, would I stay here again: YES. It is old-school, full of history, with an unusual European-American charm and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “In search of some tea!”
Reviews.Author: lavitaedolce
Reviews.Content: Everyone is unanimous, the historic building and public areas are sumptuous! The swimming pool itself beautifully tiled with nymphs and dryads...but woe betide the rooms, the service and the attention to detail. I had booked 2 nights in a standard king room with breakfast and parking included. I knew the cost of wireless internet and although agree with most of you that it should be free i did not find it shocking at $10 given the cost of the same in European hotels. Upon check in I asked for a renovated room and was promptly told by the desk clerk that no rooms were renovated because "this is an historic building" (except for the flat screen TVs) and besides which he had selected a particularly nice room for me. Down several deserted hallways of the 9th floor, Iarrived at my room which reeked of stale socks and seemed oddly and sparsely furnished with hotel repro. "antique" furniture dating probably from the 1980's. It did have a flat screen TV though! Back downstairs at reception I requested a room that didn't smell and they moved me to a room with 2 beds, larger and slightly better furnished, with a view of Pershing square, still stale smelling but not as bad. Another trip downstairs to mention this and to request some tea bags in my room so I could use the little kettle they supply you with. "With honey?" they ask. Oh wow, yes please! The solution to the smell was an ionizer which meant I would have to vacate the room for an hour while it was plugged in. Perfect time to go to the gorgeous pool for a nice relaxing swim. And indeed it was relaxing, nary a soul in sight and plenty of clean towels. The only thing was that it was so very bare bones as far as lotions, shampoos, hair products, tea, apples etc...... this functions as a membership club for the public as well as available to hotel guests so I was pretty surprised that it did not supply anything but some rather generic soap and lotion in wall dispensers; The shower in the locker room appeared to be in use by a very dirty person as the water was constantly running. The I saw the sign that it was out of order Only 50 minutes had passed so a spot of sushi at Sai Sai the in house Japanese restaurant, very nice service I might add by Edwin.....limited selection of fish though. Finally back to the room and ready for tea but no sign of tea bags yet . The good news was that the room no longer smelled bad. Call to the reception and no knowledge of my request for tea and was told curtly there was no honey available ever. OK send tea up anyway, please!..It was there in 5 minutes! The bed was very comfortable but i did not sleep well because of the noise of the buses starting up at 6AM. Perhaps I needed to change rooms again ! The following morning, down to Smeraldi's for the inclusive buffet breakfast. But "oh no" says the man, where is my coupon? What coupon? So back to reception...oh dear you should have been given one at check-in, well we cant find any at the moment but we will phone over there to let them know it is OK. Back to Smeraldi's for tea and the buffet breakfast. Tea with milk if you don't mind. The tea pots are weird and don't have lids letting all the heat escape. The waiter forgets the tea bags...are they on a mission to save them for the special and reportedly excellent afternoon tea ???They do seem awfully scarce. Finally get a tea bag, steep it for ages as the water was tepid and add milk....oops it curdles. Did i add lemon, asks the waiter. Dah!!!! anyone 1/2 way in their right mind knows you cant add milk and lemon to the same cup of tea. The buffet was very nice though with an omelette station too for those that like that kind of thing I decided not to move rooms again in case i had to go through all the other stuff again so turned on the air conditioning to drown out the sound of the traffic. It worked! I have rambled on enough now and must go...but one more comment about the little bathroom....bathtub had been re-conditioned, you know painted over and was flaking off in one corner, nice! and the toiletries were so generic that one would not imagine being in a 4 star. There were lots of nice clean towels though and the lighting was OK . Would I stay there again? Not on your nelly!

Reviews.Title: “Vast, gorgeous, lobbies, much less to love elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: divisaderoguy
Reviews.Content: Downtown LA offers an odd collection of monster hotels built over the past century. The Biltmore appears to be the oldest exemplar. Updates through the decades have addressed parking and ventilation and even put in okay wi-fi. But my room was charmless, austere and in general some place I wanted to hang out in as little as possible. Particular issues were a non-working desk phone, the noise and performance of the air-conditioning, the size and positioning of the small and ancient television (and the lack of key channel choices such as Comedy Central) and a bathroom whose size was, I guess, okay in the 1920s but today is outclassed by any roadside motel. I suppose at some price it's an acceptable choice, and the lobby is indeed a marvel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Interesting good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: breaklikethewind
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Biltmore with my family, excellent service and friendly staff. Went out of their way to be helpful. Rooms very comfortable , air con good, Bathroom very good. Rooms clean. A very large Hotel with function rooms, shop and Internet Computer room, and lots more . Nice breakfast, buffet recommended. Decor very interesting. An old hotel with lots of history and character. In a good location for Pershing Square Metro station. Handy if your going to Hollywood, Universal Studios or Long Beach. All in all I thought it was good value and would certainly stay there again if I went to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time”
Reviews.Author: julie1957London
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay at the Millennium Biltmore. The rooms are large and comfortable but it is the lobby and ground floor rooms that are amazing. I felt like i was back in the 20's. The Biltmore bar has great jazz and a great place for a cocktail, especially the Black Dahlia, and a special created by the lovely Bartender Whitney. Can't remember what it was called, but it had cinnamon and elderflower liqueur in it. The ballrooms are fabulous, and great to look around and try to imagine what it was like in it's heyday.

Reviews.Title: “Biltmore Hotel.. LA”
Reviews.Author: ricindy
Reviews.Content: The service I got from the front desk to the security of my suite was awsome. This is a great hotel. BEEN TRYING TO RESERVE A SUITE FOR NOVEMBER,2011. For some reason, I'm not allowed to go past MAY 2011. Oh well, hear that the ole ROOSEVELT(sp) is open, History is fun, (Fatty Arbucklle, St Francis)

Reviews.Title: “A nice comfortable hotel, but watch out for parking charges”
Reviews.Author: DonnlaNicGearailt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while my husband attended a conference and I had a nice holiday. This is a grand traditional hotel with imposing lobby and well-appointed rooms. Our room was large and very clean. We were very pleased with our stay. Wi-fi was only free in the lobby. It's a long way from Hollywood and Santa Monica, so if you stay here while doing the tourist things you'll spend a lot of time on the freeway, but as long as you avoid rush hour this isn't really a problem. Be aware that this hotel charges 40 dollars a night for parking, but there is a much cheaper 24hr covered parking garage across the street from the back door.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing history, renovated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: baycyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights when my beloved other downtown hotels were sold out (JW Marriott, Omni, Sheraton) b/c of conventions. I'm embarrassed to say that I was not aware of the history of this gem; just knew that it was old. Some reviews indicated rooms sub-par, but many if not most have been renovated and are spacious and very nice. Windows open on upper floors so you can get some outside air, but inside air/heating work great. Flatscreen TVs, internet connection, and all that wonderful history. They film here virtually every night because of the atmosphere. I can't wait to take my husband to see this place -- he'll love it. PS Don't forget to see the pool area... takes you back to the days of real Hollywood glamour!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms Are Fine”
Reviews.Author: Taureg
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned by the extremely negative reviews this hotel had received, which I read AFTER my non-refundable booking. I had decided to stay here because USC put my friends here, and I wanted to be at the same hotel so, atypically, I didn't do any research first. After reading the reviews, I was quite alarmed, so I called Reservations and was promised that I would be given a room on the 8th or 9th floors, which had been renovated. When I got to the hotel, they gave me a free upgrade to the 11th floor. The 10th and 11th floors have also been renovated and are the nicest rooms in the hotel. The room was large, clean, the bed comfortable and there was no noise and lots of light. I faced Pershing Square. Other friends who were staying there commented that corners were cut on the renovation, e.g., the tub was re-enameled instead of replaced, and was starting to chip; the door knobs were old, etc - all true, so maybe this isn't a full 5 star. I didn't have much interaction with the staff but what I did have was fine. We didn't eat at the hotel - people who don't want to pay a lot for breakfast can walk around the corner to Starbucks or a small bakery. There's not a lot to do in the immediate vicinity of the hotel at night, which is a bit dodgy. Broadband costs $10 (??) a day - I didn't try it. I took the Flyaway bus from LAX to Union Station ($7) and then the Red or Purple Metro 2 stops to Pershing Square ($1.50), which makes getting to the hotel both inexpensive and about as quick as taking a taxi ($46). It is a 3 block walk from the metro to the hotel. In summary, I don't know what the unrenovated rooms are like, but the ones on floors 8 - 11 are fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value; Stunning Architecture”
Reviews.Author: jax88SD
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit to the Millennium Biltmore by my wife and me. The public areas in this hotel are breathtaking and invoke a far more elegant period of travel history. Our room was quite nice. We booked a "Club Room," which included access to the Club Room Lounge and afternoon tea overlooking Pershing Square. The room was adequately sized, very comfortable, well-appointed, and also had view of Pershing Square. Our dinner at Smeraldis was excellently prepared and the service there, and for that matter, everywhere at the Biltmore, was professional and attentive at all times. For an expertly prepared cocktail in the most elegant of settings, you must visit the Gallery Bar. Again, I cannot say enough about the courtesy, helpfulness, and professionalism of the staff we encountered at this fine hotel. You can spend more at other establishments, but from our experience, when taking into account the caliber of the facility and the level of service, you will be hard pressed to find a better value. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It's been 10 years and not alot had changed”
Reviews.Author: imreading
Reviews.Content: I had fond memories of staying at the Biltmore 10 years ago. Business brought me back for a 4 night stay. As many others have mentioned it is an old iconic hotel in downtown LA. I would give the hotel a 4 star rating based on my latest experience were it not for one glaring item. That is the shower curtain. May sound strange, but even with the bathroom door shut, the straight shower curtain blows and provides you about 1 foot of space between the curtain and the shower wall, neither of which I cared to be in contact with. A quick and easy fix is a semi circular shower rod, this would provide the needed space. So for four mornings in a row, this was an irritant. The small glass shelves in the bathroom test your coordination skills with toiletries and contact lenses as well. Otherwise the rest of the hotel was great, as I said not much has changed...

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Lovely Building”
Reviews.Author: Zachary_Scott
Reviews.Content: We were visiting for the Abilities Expo and were in three rooms before we settled. The first room was great, but we had reserved a lounge floor room. The second was smaller, and we were there one night. The next morn we saw a room open and asked if we could upgrade and they said yes...we also saw one other room that was a two bath studio and a standard single room. Each room of the 5 was unique and interesting. Our final room only had a king bed, and we got a rollaway, which was amazingly comfortable. My son loved the "tent" in our final room. The lounge food was great all three days, and varied enough day to day to keep it interesting. The staff was patient and accomodating. The hotel was well worth exploring and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “World class looks, Motel 6 service”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLover72
Reviews.Content: And that's a mean thing to say about motel 6 actually! I have stayed in some world class hotels - the Negresco in Nice, the Baglioni in Rome, closer to home the Beverly Hilton. And yes...those historic hotels can be a bit rundown, but what they had in common was GREAT SERVICE, sadly lacking here. whatever I asked for I got, with a smile, in those other hotels. Yes, the room rate was twice as much, but I stay maybe for two nights a year...it's more like 200 nights I need to be at the Biltmore. so I got service for $500 that I can't get for $25000 at the Biltmore! worst corporate deal ever...still checking the contract with my rep because it's so bad I cant believe it. Free wireless, that's it. and when I asked for free late checkout I got attitude! not because they were too booked but they just don't do it if it's not in the contract. Or to put it another way - they'll treat you as badly as they can get away with. Guess I know why no one else from the company stays here! I see a certain sameness to the hotel response here...'so sorry, excuse, excuse we' ll do better next time.' WELL IM CALLING THEIR BLUFF I'm returning next week (why? The pool, hottub and sauna work wonders on my arthritic hips). I'll see if there's any improvement and report back the results. I noticed

Reviews.Title: “Should be a Museum, not a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Neduq627
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is without a doubt a beautiful and historic hotel. My wife and I immediately recognized the lobby, hallway and banquet area from several movies, TV shows and music videos filmed there. There is a true "old" Hollywood charm to the hotel and the staff was very friendly. But the perks end there! The room was very outdated, there was a musty smell in the room that never went away, and we quickly discovered why they provide ear plugsâ€¦ the pipes clink loudly all through the night! The vent in the bathroom door was caked with dust and dirt, which could have easily been cleaned. Also be warned they advertise a pool, however it is closed to the public because it is no longer in compliance with Californiaâ€™s safety code. They also charge about $40 dollars for parking. I would recommend stopping in to see the hotelâ€™s historic common areas, but staying some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous historical hotel!”
Reviews.Author: booklover29
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I booked the "Now, Then & Again" package with afternoon tea on Saturday and a Sunday hotel tour led by a docent from the LA Conservancy. Parking in Pershing Square was reasonable and easily accessible. James, the concierge, took the time to confirm our tour before his shift ended and Saul provided impeccable service in the lovely Rendezvous Court's afternoon tea. Our huge room on the 9th floor was luxurious and overlooked Pershing Square. Walking distance to the LA Public Library, Disney Concert Hall, theatres and MOCA. Take Angel's Flight for only 25 cents down to the Grand Central Market. Enjoy a sunset with drinks on the 34th floor of the very near Bonaventure. But, don't miss ordering a Black Dahlia in the Gallery Bar. We enjoyed live jazz Saturday night and very efficient room service. Our perfect weekend ended with a walking tour of this beautiful historical gem. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: knockstatus
Reviews.Content: Well let me start by saying, this hotel is very over rated. Me and three friends went to take a vacation, we seen the hotel on orbit and looked very legit. Orbit did not mention the $40.00 a day to park. Service there was not good at all considering how much we were paying. We get in our hotel room and the room its self was fairly big but very old inside, not vintage old! There was no fridge no microwave, there was a TV that would have been nice about 20 years ago. Leaving the hotel was a hassle, valet parking was very unorganized on all occasions in getting our car to leave took 15 minutes or longer. The only good thing about the hotel was the location in down town. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Grand, but would rather stay at a Motel with Free Wi-Fi and a Newer TV”
Reviews.Author: mistermark8
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how this hotel could be rated so high as a 4-5 star hotel, when the rooms are small and need updating. The hallways are an ugly yellow from what I can remember and seemed a little scary like an old movie. Gym is nice but equipment could be upgraded. The rooms need the most help. The television sucks as well as the bathroom is the size of a closet. The hotel needs to offer wi-fi and needs to be remodeled ASAP to survive the next generation of hotels and amenities. The hotel is beautiful throughout the lobby and dining areas, Please Millenium, update this hotel before it's too late.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable hotel with a real history”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate the L.A. Marathon organizing committee,b ut even the regular rate would have been okay (not a bargain, but okay). Remembering a previous stay, I asked for a room with a safe: not all rooms have those, and those that do seem to be on the club level. I found the room comfortable. I had a king bed. Wi-Fi connectivity cost about $10 but was without any problems. I still like the old-fashioned indoor pool in the baement, next to the fitness room. I certainly did not find the hallways like something from the movie "The Shining," though there's one large, historic photo of an event in the 1920s, locasted in the lobby hallway, that did remind me of the film (in a good way). There were lots of events, especlly weddings, taking place, but none impacted me at all. As noted, the bar and restaurants are far from cheap, but my dinner in the hotel's Italian restaurant was reasonable for a hotel ($18 for excellent lasagna). I didn't have a car, so didn't worry about the high parking rate. The Pershing Square subway station is a block away, making for easy access to Hollywood, Universal Studios, Union Station and other locations. Angels Flight, Staples Center, Grand Central Market, etc. are within easy walking distance. Bottom line is that the hotel had a comfortable, elegant and historic feel.

Reviews.Title: “You're better off at a motel 6”
Reviews.Author: sweetmeowmeow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a work convention. The nice thing about this hotel was the common area. The decor is very nice and to be honest that's what probably attracts visitors to this area. Their bar is also very nice (but very expensive $18 a drink) and customer service was the best at the bar. There was a nice older gentleman assisting us at the bar and he was great! The rest of the staff could take a tip in customer service and work on acknowledging and greeting their customers with a smile. The worst part about this hotel is that people EXPECT a tip, as if what they are doing was going out of their way when actually it's their job. I tip anyway, but their faces seem to beg for a tip. The actual hallways to the rooms were like a scene from "The Shining." Everything was old and looked like it needed some updating. The room itself consisted of one bed, which was very uncomfortable, and one antique armoire which held the T.V. and one nightstand, which was a pain for us given only one person had access to the light. The old fashioned shutters, while gave a nice effect to the room, required dusting and it looked like they had been painted over their dust. There was no mini-fridge in the room so keeping your own refrigerated snacks was not an option. Additionally, the room was very cold and the heat took forever to kick in, while some other colleagues reported theirs not working as well as trouble with flickering lights. The windows themselves have not been replaced so that would explain the noise levels coming from outside and difficulty keeping the room warm. There were no extra blankets provided in the rooms on hand as other hotels would provide. Now, their site says that all rooms are equipped with 1) flat screen t.v.s (false, our room had a boxed older t.v.) 2) mp3 docking station (false, just a telephone) and 3) wi-fi for a fee (No connectivity to the internet in our room, plus the rate would be $10 PER appliance). Additionally, we had to manually turn off the lamps individually, no wall switch to control them which is kind of a pain. The walls were so thin you could hear the elevator bell ringing and people talking as they walked up and down the hallways. The bathroom was the worst hotel bathroom I have seen in a long time. I think hospital bathrooms are nicer. It really looked like they tried to make the interior nice by decorating with a "nice" mirror but really, they didn't try hard enough. The paint was awful, the water pressure while I didn't mind it was like you were standing under Niagara Falls, the sink slightly draped over the the bathtub, and one of the mirrors in the bathroom was just plain tacky. They really should have put a mirror in the bedroom because it was difficult for two people to share the mirror in the bathroom. The toilet was old and really needed replacing, no counter space what-so-ever, the bathroom fan looked like it needed replacing, and you could see the outline on the ceiling of an access door. The board rooms where the conferences were held varied from appearance. Of course the Crystal room was nice, spacious with it's balcony seating above. Other rooms however, were UN-AIRCONDITIONED which was awful as the AC was not working. It felt like we were in a sauna since there were so many people in there and we were not allowed to keep the doors open secondary to safety regulations. I was wondering what the hotel staff would have done if someone passed out due to a heat stroke. Their on line site is sketchy. There are no details on where to park. I wonder if that is because valet is $40 a night. And the rooms pictured on their site look NOTHING like the room I stayed in. At the rate of $189 (which was the convention fee price) plus $26 in occupancy fees, I definitely felt better off sleeping at motel 6. If in the area, try the Kyoto Grand. That hotel is A LOT nicer and worth your buck. There are other historical hotels that are able to maintain their historical theme without sacrificing comfort in a MODERN way Overall, my experience with the hotel was poor. They get one star for the decor of their common areas and nothing more. I will not be visiting the Biltmore Hotel in L.A. ever again.

Reviews.Title: “You Can's Ask For More In A Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoltzMan
Reviews.Content: There really can't be any doubt that the Millenium Biltmore is one of the very finest grand hotels in the United States. That's a hard lead sentence to follow up, but it's true. We stayed there this past weekend, and were delighted, in every way. Our room was one of the "club" rooms on the 10th/11th floors, and it was immaculate, with very elegant furnishings, spotless cleanliness (I couldn't find a speck of mold in the small but bright bathroom), and housekeeping touches that spoke of pride and quality. I was tempted to drop a quarter on the tightly-packed sheets to see if it would bounce but it was too enjoyable to slowly lean back on the soft but firm mattress and many soft pillows! Small toucbhes like a few sheets of actual hotel stationery, table lamps with electrical sockets to plug a cell phone to, and partially-opening outside windows made the room just wonderful. A safe, ironing board, and more (a coffee maker and coffee on request) such as free shoe shining (for Club) and robes. The hotel facilities are beyond description, too: The Club Lounge provides beer/wine and extensive hors d'oerves (some hot) so that we really didn't want dinner, and the breakfast rolls are to die for, with real butter (no nasty little packages), free WiFi and extraordinary coffee. Soft carpets and fresh paint in the halls, and the public rooms and corridors are some of the greatest decorative facilities in America. We most of all loved the aweswome pool in the basement, by the full exercise facility, with actual teak deck lounges, unlimited towels, wonderful steam and sauna rooms, and not a chipped tile or cheap repair to be seen. The staff was wonderful too, from Reception's easy acceptance of my service dog, to the Club Lounge concierge, to the housekeeping staff. Smiles, assistance, and pride were everywhere. Prices? While not in the hostel league, we took advantage of one of the specials on the hotel web site, and found it almost as cheap as a basic hotel. To save money on parking - $40 for valet - we parked in the Pershing Square underground lot for $14, and then entered through the traditional Lobby Court, which is much like Buckingham Palace's entrance must be, except not as small and shabby. If we'd had room for food, Smereldi's was downright budget priced with beautiful food that we saw served in truly elegant surroundings. I don't write gushing reviews; this one is an anomaly, but I actually found myself searching for flaws more and more desperately. But after seeing the lovely brides in the hallways with their friends, I knew why they chose this place. It is out of a fairy tale, and I am glad I got to be part of it.

Reviews.Title: “elegant & historical,nice contrast to modern,bland styling”
Reviews.Author: tony1834
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10-14 Feb 2011,on 9th floor for tourist visit to city ,room was good size,liked the older furniture which was in keeping with style of the hotel and which is preferable to the homogenised modern styling found in many places, with reference to some recent reviews, did have sizeable flatscreen tv, bathroom not at all modern but suited the place and again added character and was ok size, room/bathroom was cleaned fine each day, no problem with noise,lifts were fine at all times,reception staff were helpful and assisted when I needed to call shuttle company as they were late for pick-up,didn't eat here,used bar in evening, bit pricey but pleasant evening, handy for pershing square subway,would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: gowhereuwant
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled from the east coast to LA for the Grammy awards. We booked a room at the Biltmore since it was the official hotel of the Grammy's. We were worried because of the negative reviews we read on this site. I decided to take the time to write a review because our experience at the Biltmore was fabulous! Check in after our long flight was quick and painless and we were able to upgrade to a club level room for only $50 a night. This allowed us to enjoy a fantastic breakfast every morning and appetizers and drinks each evening in the beautiful lounge. This hotel truly takes you back to another era. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed using the workout facilities. There is also a sauna and steam room. We used the beauty salon and were quite satisfied with the services. The food is great in the restaurants as well as room service. Don't miss the bar and the weekend entertainment. Our room was large and well kept. The maid service was impeccable. The bathroom is small, but we found it to be quite adequate. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Art Deco hotel - simply breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: tropicgirl39
Reviews.Content: What a glorious hotel. Art deco with breathtaking murals, grand lobby, fountains and luxurious carpets. Each part of the hotel is simply glorious. It is even more stunning in real life than in the photographs. We had a gorgeous corner room - it was massive with views over the outdoor ice skating rink across the road. Dinner at the Italian restaurant in the hotel was a culinary sensation. Cocktails at the bar with Greg, the cocktail bartender made for an unforgettable evening. Breakfast the next morning in a room surrounded by beautiful murals, was fabulous. Great location - a short taxi ride away from Union station. The only slight criticism I have and I do not hold this against the hotel, as it is such a large hotel is that I had to telephone reception a couple of times to request that our room be made up. However this did not dampen our joy at staying at this absolutely breathtaking hotel. We would not hesitate to stay here again next time we're in LA.

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Rtmfrog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely in need of a renovation. The rooms were extremely noisy!!!! If you have to stay at this hotel, make sure to request a room NOT facing a street!!! Also, the bathrooms were dirty and tiny. The tv was a 16 inch box that was 25 years old. This hotel has outlived it's glory days!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant staff, unhelpful, unfriendly, very bad customer service'”
Reviews.Author: AnkaQ
Reviews.Content: ....the reception staff doesn't greet you even though you say hello to them, thay didn't want to call a taxi for me even though i was going to miss my plane, and it was a real emergency... they didnt help me when i arrived and told me in a rude manner 'lift is over there', that's all. the A/c was noisy at night...the building was nice...but the staff so ...RUDE! never again! Luckily my hotel in NY was good and staff was kind.

Reviews.Title: “One of The worst hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: wescravn
Reviews.Content: Interesting how people talk about this hotel as having charm, when nothing could be further from the truth. I got there and was like WTF. The lobby was very nice, but when I arrived in the room, that was a completely different scenario. It looked like it hadn't been updated since the 1920's (when it was built), and the rust on the bathroom light fixtures proved it. It's old, rundown and dilapidated. I immediately complained, because hotwire rated this as a four star. The hotel concierge told me know this is maybe a three star. I could agree with that, but 2.5 would be more accuarate. No modern ammentity's and the hotel was never renovated. Sad cause this could actually be a nice place. I felt like I was staying at a downtown homeless shelter. It was really bad, and I called hotwire. They said they would refund my money, but it was too late, everything else was superhigh, and pricey. I was upset.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Historic Hotel in convenient downtown location”
Reviews.Author: RobertFlorida
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights over New Year's weekend while attending the Rose Bowl with a group. Our room on the third floor faced the courtyard so street noise was not a problem It was clean and apparently recently renovated, except for the television which was a bit blurry; a flat screen would have been a welcome addition. The bathroom wass clean, although the fixtures are a bit dated. The public areas of this hotel are what makes it a real gem. It takes you back to the 1940's with it's elegance and is a welcome change from the bland modern corporate type hotels. We found the staff to be very friendly, efficient and helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent, as was the Italian buffet in the lower level restaurant which we enoyed New Year's night. The hotel is convenient to downtown attractions such as the Staples center, museums, concert halls, etc. We enjoyed our stay very much and look forward to returning. If you like a historic hotel with character this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to stay in Los Angeles! Overpriced and over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: azroxie
Reviews.Content: -$40 for Valet Parking or $30 for a private parking garage around the corner, next to Dominoes Pizza. RIP-OFF! -$10 for wi-fi. RIP-OFF! -Comfy bed, pretty decor, good water pressure. Weird toilet in bathroom...no toilet tank, looks like public restroom toilet. -Semi-friendly staff. Sometimes, they spoke like cordial robots...they WON'T guarantee a room with two-beds either. -Gift shop with over-priced items...about $3 for a bottle of soda. RIP-OFF! -Beautiful lobby. -Paper-thin walls/doors (heard loud teens from a Church Dance group slamming doors all night long...even after midnight!!!! Had to call security twice to STOP this!) -Stain on furniture. -Central air...the one in room doesn't truly control the individual room temperature. Says A/C, but was blasting heat into the room like a giant hair dryer. -On 11th Floor, could still hear traffic outside below. -The halls smell "vintage"...or maybe it was cigarette smoke? -Elevators take FOREVER, esp when you are stuck getting a room at a higher level. The elevators would stop at EVERY floor most of the time even though no one was on the floors it stopped at...creepy! -Bathroom had a shower cap, stinky lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel, plus 2 bars of soap. No counter space for toiletries. -Dodge wandering shower curtain in shower...it will stick to you like a dryer fabric sheet.. -Good Kleenex brand of tissue. Better quality of toilet paper in bathroom than most hotels have...a BONUS! -I would NEVER stay here again, nor would I recommend it to anyone. Find a different place, if you want a decent night's sleep. This place is the WORST place I have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “What a sad surprise”
Reviews.Author: kct331
Reviews.Content: Expected a luxurious, comfortable hotel and was instead shocked by the exceptionally low quality of everything in the rooms. The vents hadn't been cleaned in years, the bathrooms reminded me of an old high school gymnasium, the beds were reasonable, but definitely not what should be expected, the television was an old Magnavox from what looked to be from the late 70's to early 80's. The hotel has a lot of history and the lobby and meeting areas are top notch. However, the rooms look to be the same as they were in their heyday. VERY disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrmull
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to downtown Los Angeles frequently to attend concerts at the Walt Disney Hall on Grand Avenue. Our hotel of choice during these visits is the Omni, just a short walk away, but the Omni was booked both times we attended events in January. Our backup was the Biltmore, where we had never stayed before. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is beautiful with lots of history. All of the public areas are magnificent, with high ceilings and lovely architecture. The hotel prides itself on its history and displays many old photographs of Hollywood stars attending events at the hotel over the years, including the Academy of Awards. If you are a lover of gracious, old hotels, this is a great place to stay. We stayed on the Club level and the rooms were nice. The bathrooms, however, are tiny (in the style of old hotel bathrooms) and really not big enough for two people. The Club lounge was also pleasant but we found the offerings there to be less than the Omni Club lounge. We only ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant and found it more than adequate--the buffet is quite good. The walk to the Disney Hall from the Biltmore is about two blocks longer than from the Omni with a very steep hill to climb. We will go back to the Omni in March when we return to LA but the Biltmore is a good backup if the Omni is full.

Reviews.Title: “Old World charm”
Reviews.Author: drviljoen
Reviews.Content: As every other reviewer is pointing out! The arrival seems to be spectacular due to the impressive foyer and restaurant. It is truly old world and beautifully done. You need a car when you stay at the hotel over a weekend as down town LA is very quiet during that time, and public transport is not frequent. The shopping malls around the hotel is closed on sundays and the nearest shopping mall seems to be The Grove (plus minus 10 miles away). The food in the hotel is expensive and not very noteworthy. The hotel might be ideal for the businessman doing business down town LA. Not really for the holiday traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice lobby , but the rooms needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: BugsbunnyRO
Reviews.Content: Well the location of the hotel is good . Right in the city center . The lobby is fantastic . You get the feeling of very stylish hotel . Nice cages and a good bar full of people every night . The only dissapoinment were the rooms , which are old decorated and the furniture is old . The baths are bad as well . The rooms needs urgent renovation . We also upgraded the room , but the new one was the same only a little bigger .

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: przyk
Reviews.Content: The lobby and public areas are as interesting as I had been lead to believe in all the previous reviews. I even stepped into the empty Crystal Room to look around. This is the room that was used for the Academy Award ceremonies in the old days. On our morning of departure the room was closed with a sign stating movie filming in progress please do not disturb. Our room was adequate. The queen bed was comfy and the bathroom plumbing worked okay. The TV was small. The odd thing about the room is there was no dresser to put clothes in. There was a huge walk in closet with only about 8 hangers. I used the ledge of the closet for my folded clothes. There were a few small shelves in the TV unit that my companion used. There was also a safe in the TV unit. The room was large, so there was plenty of space to add a dresser. The bathroom was also very small, not uncommon for old hotels, but frustrating because of the wasted space in the room and the walk in closet. We could hear people talking in the hallway, but it was not a big issue because we were at the end of the hallway in Room 368 and not many people walked by.
